It was founded as a small rural village at the end of the XIX Century, but due to demographic expansion is one of the most populated communities in Chile, with more than 600,000 inhabitants.  It is the entranceway into the Andean foothills in the metropolitan area known as Cajón del Mapio, which has many trails, routes, rafting and other activities as well as accommodation and food services.

loans.use: To buy materials to make a new oven to bake bread.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe, es casado, vive con su esposa y cinco hijos, él se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y a la agricultura, este oficio lo aprendió de su padre y lleva 20 años dedicándose a esta actividad, todos los días se levanta a las 4:00am a atender sus labores.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de cerdos y compra de insumos agrícolas como abono y fertilizantes, este préstamo será una gran ayuda para Felipe, ya que él y su familia dependen de este trabajo.
Para él tener buenas cosechas y una granja con cerdos sanos, son los objetivos que se traza, ya que se esfuerza cada día por realizar una buena labor y por dar a su familia el sustento diario.
texts.en:
Felipe is married and lives with wife and five children.  He raises pigs and farms the land, as he learned to do from his father.  He's been in the business for 20 years and gets up every morning at 4:00 a.m. to start his workday.

He is requesting a loan to buy pigs and farm supplies, such as fertilizer.  The loan will be of great help to Felipe and his family who depend on his work for income.

His goals are to obtain a good harvest and raise healthy pigs.  He works hard to do a good job and provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy pigs and farm supplies such as fertilizer.

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
Una mujer con mucho optimismo y sueños,  nació en la selva del Perú y desD. muy joven vino a la ciudad, y es ahí donD. conoce a su esposo y tiene un hijo, es presidenta del grupo Mujeres en Acción.
Ella inicio en la venta D. jugos y pasteles en la vía publica, durante muchos años, lamentablemente enfermó y tuvo que dejarlo, nuevamente las ganas y la necesidad D. aportar al hogar  e invertir en los estudios D. su único hijo la motivaron para iniciar su nuevo proyecto: venta D. productos D. belleza: -”yo tengo muchas amigas, me encanta visitarlas, así es que pensé ¿porque no venderles algo que las ayuD.?, así me decidí a iniciar este negocio”……
Además D. su principal negocio,  también venD. gelatinas y pasteles en su domicilio.
Mariela tiene un sueño: tener su bazar-bodega…”allí podría vender también mis jugos y pasteles”
texts.en:
This is an optimistic woman with many dreams who was born in the Peruvian jungle.  At a very young age she came to the city where she met her husband and had a son.  She is the president of the group "Mujeres en Acción".

Many years ago she began as a juice and pastry vendor in the streets but unfortunately fell ill and had to cease her activity.  But the need to help support the family and invest in her son's education encouraged her to begin a new project: selling beauty products.  "I have many friends and love to visit them, so I thought about selling them something that would help them and I set up my business."....

In addition to this business she also sells gelatin and pastry on a door-to-door basis.  Mariela's dream is to open a variety store... "There I can also sell juice and pastry."

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her beauty products business.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia, D. 37 años, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Sosimo D. 42 años y sus 04 queridos hijos y lo que más desea es brindarles una mejor calidad D. vida, para lo cual esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro. Todos los días, desD. muy temprano por la mañana, Lidia  y su pareja salen a labrar sus tierras,  para ellos no existen los días D. feriado, ya que tienen que trabajar continuamente para obtener una buena producción y con ello ofrecer un mejor porvenir para sus hijos. Sus principales productos son: el cacao, café, plátano y achiote, que tiene mucha demanda en el mercado central D. San Francisco. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es la libertad para trabajar en el campo, ya que pueD. disfrutar libremente D. sus verdes paisajes. Sin embrago el tener que cuidarlos D. la plaga D. insectos le resulta muy difícil. Para el futuro, planea comprar nuevas tierras para aumentar su productividad. Este será su noveno crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo D. cada uno D. ustedes para que pueda concretar sus planes. Asimismo se compromete una vez más para pagar sus cuotas. En su banco comunal es una persona responsable y participe. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más semillas D. café para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Lidia, 37, is a hard worker who lives in her own house with her husband, Sosimo, 42, and their four beloved children.  What she wants most is to offer them the best possible lifestyle, so she is willing to work very hard.  Everyday, from very early on in the morning Lidia and her husband go out to work the fields.  They never have a day off since they must work constantly to ensure a good harvest so they can proviD. for their children.  Their main crops are cocoa, coffee, banana and annatto, which are in much demand in the central market in San Francisco.

She has been in business for 10 years and enjoys the freedom of working in the fields among the green scenery.  But protecting the crops from insect plagues is the hardest challenge.  In the future she plans to buy more land to increase production.  This is her ninth loan through MFP and she is counting on everyone of you to be able to carry out her plans.  She is committed to paying it back on time.  She is a responsible, partipating member of her communal bank.  With the 1,000 PEN loan she plans to buy coffee seeds for the next planting cycle.

loans.use: To buy coffee seeds.

loans.name: Evelio Gregorio

texts.es: Evelio Gregorio tiene su negocio que es la venta de semilla de jícaro. Tiene más 11 años, con esta actividad. Ha logrado obtener una gran experiencia con este medio de vida. Tiene 4 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, es un padre que siempre se preocupa por proporcionarles a sus hijos los ingresos necesarios. Inicio este medio de vida por sus padres quienes le enseñaron esta humilde labor. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de semilla de jícaro. Sueña con  mejorar cada día su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Evelio Gregorio has been selling calabash tree seeds for 11 years.  This means of earning a living has provided him with his greatest experience.  He has four minor children in his care and is always worried about making enough income to give them everything they need.

His parents taught him this humble trade and he is requesting a loan to buy calabash tree seeds.  His dream is to improve his lifestyle on a daily business.

loans.use: To buy calabash tree seeds.

loans.name: Israel Group 1, 2 & 3

texts.en:
Olimpia is a member of the group Israel 1, 2 & 3, which is based in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial town north of Santo Domingo. All the members of this group are engaged in different types of sales, such as clothing, shoes, groceries and many other items.

Olimpia, a single mother, makes her home in a simple structure with her three children. Her most difficult challenges are to educate her children, to provide for all their needs and to help her daughter recover from a hearing problem. She requires a loan to buy beauty products for her beauty salon and some natural products; she has a stall in her salon where she sells natural medicine. This is her first loan with Esperanza International.

She decided to take a loan because she is very interested in developing her businesses; also, Esperanza Internacional clients are mostly women, and she identifies with the program. She has had her business for over six years, having decided to start it after she learned about the beauty career. Olimpia will use the profits as savings.

Olimpia and her group are thankful for your support!

loans.use: to buy beauty and natural products.

loans.name: Salomon

texts.es:
Salomón es un padre de familia de cinco hijos, tiene la edad de 50 años, casado, y su oficio guarda de seguridad. 
Sabe de la construcción ya que por muchos años laboro en el oficio, lo único que había semana que no trabajaba lo que  busca un trabajo fijo, así como otros beneficios en la salud, ya que es lo más caro.
Como objetivo ha sido la construcción de su casa, el cual lo ha venido logrando por medio del financiamiento, en donde  tiene bien avanzada la construcción y que con este nuevo préstamo será para seguir levantando paredes de los cuartos, lo cual espera avanzar ya que va parte por parte. Siendo los materiales de construcción lo más caros. Materiales a comprar: doscientos bloques, hierro, cemento, estribos, laminas de zinc.
texts.en:
Salomón is a father of five children.  He is 50 years old, married, and works as a security guard.

Salomón knows about building work because he worked for many years in that trade.  The only problem was that there were weeks when he didn't have any work, so he looked for a permanent job which also gave him other benefits, particularly health benefits, as health care is very expensive.

Salomón's goal has been to build his house and he has gradually achieved this through loans.  The building work is now at an advanced stage and he will use this new loan to continue building the walls of his rooms which he hopes to make progress with since he is building the house bit by bit.  The building supplies are the most expensive thing.  He will buy 200 blocks, iron, cement, beams and sheets of corrugated metal.

loans.use: to invest in construction supplies to finish building his home which is already at an advanced stage

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila tiene 31 años, es una mujer alegre y laboriosa, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Julián de 32 años y sus 05 queridos hijos, a quienes desean brindarle una buena comodidad. En su querido pueblo de Bethel, Luzmila ha pasado la mayor parte de su vida, aprendiendo la actividad agrícola. Hoy trabaja en sus propias tierras al lado de su amado esposo, y juntos cultivan cacao, café y árboles maderables, trabajo que le ha brindado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a toda su familia. Es así, todo lo que cosecha es vendido en los centros de acopio ubicados en la ciudad de San Francisco, lugar donde percibe mejores ganancias. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras para que pueda aumentar su  productividad. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de todos ustedes para que pueda concretar sus objetivos. En su banco comunal es una integrante muy activa y respetada. Con el crédito solicitado comprará abonos y fertilizantes para que sus plantas desarrollen completamente.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 31 years old.  She is a cheerful and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 32 year-old Julián, and her five beloved children who she would like to provide with a lot of comfort in life.

Luzmila has spent most of her life in her beloved village of Bethel, learning how to farm.  Today she works her own land alongside her much-loved husband and together they grow cacao, coffee and timber-yielding trees.  This work has provided her with the money she needs to support her whole family.  Everything she harvests is sold to middlemen in the city of San Francisco.  This is where she makes the best profits.

Luzmila has been in this business for ten years and what she most enjoys about her work is sowing her land.  She does this with a lot of care.  Over time, she would like to buy new land so that she can increase her productivity.

This will be Luzmila's second loan from MFP and she hopes that you will support her in fulfilling her goals.  She is a very active and well-respected member of her community bank and she will use the loan she has requested to buy manure and fertilizers which will help her plants to fully develop.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Walter Agustin

texts.es:
Walter es un padre de familia de 56 años, tiene casa propia donde vive con su esposa e hijos, la cual  cuenta con el servicio de agua y luz, ubicado en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortíz que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Este distrito se caracteriza porque su gente se  dedica al comercio de productos al por mayor y menor y a manejar vehículos de transporte público.

Walter labora desde algunos años  manejando su carro haciendo taxi a los diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Chiclayo como fuera de ella, cuando realiza servicio a otros lugares puede cobrar un poco más por eso le conviene, trabaja en  su vehículo mañana y tarde, esto le permite tener más ingresos para poder solventar sus obligaciones familiares.

Por lo mismo ha visto la posibilidad de pedir un préstamo a Edpyeme Alternativa de 1600 nuevos soles para realizar mantenimiento a su herramienta de trabajo (vehículo) y cambiar algunos repuestos para que siga brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes y con más seguridad.  Walter es una persona muy conocida por la zona donde vive por ser muy responsable, respetuoso con sus  pasajeros y con mucho trabajo desea brindarle una mejor oportunidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Walter is a 56 year-old father; he has his own house where he lives with his wife and children, and which has water and electricity service.  It is located in the district of José Leonardo Ortiz, which belongs to Chiclayo province.  This district is characterized by its people working in wholesale and retail commerce, and in operating public transport vehicles.

Walter has been working for some years driving his car as a taxi to different places in the Chiclayo city and beyond.  When he provides this service to other places, he can charge a little more for the convenience.  He works in his vehicle morning and evening, this allows him to earn more income to meet his family obligations.

It is for this that he saw the possibility of taking a loan through Edpyeme Alternative for 1,600 New Soles.  This will be for maintaining his means of work (the vehicle) and replacing some parts to continue to provide good service to his customers with more safety.  Walter is well-known in the area where he lives for being very responsible, respectful of his passengers and with hard work he wants to give his children a better opportunity in life.

loans.use: to conduct maintenance and replace some parts in his taxi.

loans.name: Rosario Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario de 42 años de edad, es soltera, vive casa de su madre, la cual cuenta con servicio solo de luz, ubicada en Tongorrape que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería. 

La actividad que desarrolla Rosario es a la venta de todo tipo de productos para el consumo diario de las personas (arroz, leche, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, gaseosas, etc), negocio que ha instalado en su domicilio desde hace varios años, lo que le permite atender a cualquier hora, lo que le permite diferenciarse de otras tiendas y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar sus gastos personales.

El crédito solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1000 nuevos soles, el cual lo destinará para comprar mayor cantidad de productos y poder ampliar su negocio con más variedad productos, una vez que sus ventas aumenten podrá cubrir su préstamo y tener mejorar económicas para ella y su madre, mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosario is 42 years old and single.  She lives with her mother in a home with only electricity service, located in Tongorrape which is in the Lambayeque department.  This area is focused on agriculture and livestock.

The line of business in which Rosario works is the selling of all products for individuals' daily consumption (rice, milk, oil, sugar, toilet paper, soda, etc).  It is a business that she has operated from her home for several years, allowing her to serve her customers at any time, and allowing her to differentiate herself from other stores so that she can earn more income to cover her personal expenses.

The loan requested through Edpyme Alternativa is for 1,000 New Soles, which she plans to use to buy more products and to expand her business through a greater variety of products.  Once her sales increase, she will be able to cover her loan and have economic improvement for herself and her mother, thereby improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more products so she can grow her business.

loans.name: Francisco Teodoro

texts.es:
Francisco de 58 años de edad, vive con su esposa en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Pacora que se encuentra a una distancia larga del departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona la actividad principal es la agricultura y ganadería.

Francisco desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo y así pueda ofrecerlos a los diferentes mercados de la zona obtenindo  muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios. La otra actividad que realiza es atender su tienda que a colocado en su casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados e implementar su tienda para poder tener más clientes y satisfacer sus necesidades.  Francisco es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que sus  negocios crezcan
cada vez más para poder cubrir su crédito y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Francisco is 58 years of age and lives with his wife in his own home where they have only electrical service, located in the rural part of the Pacora district which is a long distance away from the department of Lambayeque. The primary economic activity in this region is agriculture. 

Francisco has earned a living for some years raising and selling farm animals. His corral is located in the rear portion of his home. He feeds them with enriched feed so that his animals may achieve optimal growth and thus he may sell them in the various markets of the area making very good profits with which to cover daily expenses. His other business activity is serving customers at the store he has set up in his home. 

He has requested a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy enriched feed and to stock his store so as to get more customers and meet their needs. Francisco is a hardworking person and very responsible. The only thing he wants is for his businesses to grow day by day so that he may pay off his loan and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase enriched feed for his animals and products for stocking his store.

loans.name: Mujeres De Chajabal Group

texts.es:
Doña Lidia es una señora casada, tiene 31 años D. edad, curso los seis años D. educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos 2 D. los cuales estudian la educaciòn primaria, se dedica a los ofivcios domestico y a la confeccion D. playeras, inición su negocio D. playeras por iniciativa propia y deseos D. superación, y hasta el momento lleva 10 años D. experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien se dedica a la confección D. tejidos tambien y al comercio.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizaran para la compra D. telas para ala confección D. playeras para hiños y adultos, las demas integrantes del grupo se dedican a diversas actividades: confección D. palyeras, venta D. ropa típca, elaboración y venta D. calzados y a la crianza D. animales. En el futuro quieren ver su negocio mas granD. y con mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Lidia is a married lady.  She is 31 years old and and completed six years of elementary school.  She has three children, two of whom are currently in elementary school.  Lidia does housework and also makes t-shirts.  She started her t-shirt business through her own initiative and with a desire to improve herself.  She currently has ten years experience in the business.  Lidia has the support of her husband who also weaves products and buys and sells goods.

Lidia got together a group so that they could request a loan.  She will use her loan to buy fabric for making children's and adults' t-shirts.  The other members of her group work in different businesses including: making t-shirts, selling traditional clothes, making and selling footwear, and raising animals.  In the future, Lidia would like to see her business grow and make better profits.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
José de 47 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo en casa de unos familiares; no cuenta con servicio básicos, la cual se encuentra en la zona rural del distrito de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

Desde hace 3 años José tiene su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) la cual maneja llevando pasajeros a los diferentes caseríos de la zona donde vive, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1300 nuevos soles y su destino será para brindarle mantenimiento e implementación de su mototaxi que esta presentando algunos desperfectos y necesita tenerla en buen estado para que siga trabajando, ya que es el único medio con el que mantiene su hogar.  José es una
persona que con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo a podido conseguir que sus negocio crezca y ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.
texts.en:
José, 47, lives with his wife and child in the home of family members. The home does not have basic utilities and is located in the rural part of the Olmos district which belongs to the department of Lambayeque. The area's inhabitants work in agriculture and animal husbandry. 

José has had his moto-taxi for three years (a type of transportation used for traveling short distances, with a maximum occupancy of three people) which he drives carrying passengers to the various hamlets in the area where he lives. With the income he earns he will be able to improve the quality of life of his family. 

The loan he has requested from Edpyme Alternativa is for 1,300 nuevos soles and will be used to provide maintenance and service to his moto-taxi which is showing some signs of age. He needs to have it in good condition in order to continue working, since it is the only means by which he supports his household. José is a person who through much effort and work has been able to make his businesses grow and help his family get ahead.

loans.use: to maintain and service his moto-taxi.

loans.name: Marcelo Dario

texts.es: El señor Marcelo es cliente antiguo de la institución quien trabaja 2 secuencias demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos,  el es transportista tiene un vehículo con el que trabaja a gasolina y solicito el  crédito para realizar la conversión de gasolina a gas natural, y esta conversión a el le aumentara sus ingresos y reducirá sus gastos, el Sr. Marcelo se levanta muy temprano para  trabajar con su  movilidad, ya que tiene a sus hijos pequeños, que se quedan al cuidado de su esposa, el deseo del Sr. Marcelo es el poder comprarse su casita para ofrecer mayor comodidad a su familia,  es una persona muy trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado. Ojo en la foto el Sr. Marcelo esta acompañado de su esposa.
texts.en:
Marcelo is a long-standing client of our institution who has worked through two loan cycles, demonstrating punctuality and responsibility in making his payments.

Marcelo is a taxi driver who owns a vehicle that runs on gasoline.  He is requesting this loan to convert his vehicle to run on natural gas.  This conversion would increase his profits and reduce his expenses.  Marcelo gets up very early to work in his vehicle since he has young children.  He leaves the children the care of his wife.  Marcelo's wish is to be able to buy his own home so that he can offer his family a more comfortable life.  He is a very hard-working person and is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered him.

In the photo, Marcelo is accompanied by his wife.

loans.use: to convert his taxi to run on natural gas instead of gasoline

loans.name: Juntos Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal Juntos al Progreso trabaja con Edaprospo desde hace 9 meses, integrado por 9 socios de los cuales se dedican al negocio de venta de refrescos, venta de comidas rápidas, bodegas, entre otros.
L. es una joven emprendedora dedicada a la venta de productos de primera necesidad (BODEGA ALEXANDRA), a sus 27 años tiene un hijo de 4 años, inicia sus labores en ese negocio, debido a que es despedida en su anterior trabajo.
Con el préstamo recibido anteriormente ha podido implementar su bodega y además pasar mas tiempo con su hijo, la meta de L. es construir su vivienda para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, con el préstamo recibido se realizara la compra de mercadería.
texts.en:
The 'Juntos al Progreso' (Together towards Progress) community bank has been working with Edaprospo for nine months.  It has nine members who work in different businesses including selling soft drinks, selling fast food and running a grocery store. 

L. is an entrepreneurial young woman who sells basic household products (Bodega Alexandra - Alexandra's Grocery Store).  She is 27 years old and has a 4 year-old son.  She started working in this business as she was let go from her previous job.

With her previous loan, L. was able to stock her store and also spend more time with her son.  Her goal is to build a house so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life.  She will use this loan to buy merchandise.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy men's clothes, shirts, shorts, underpants and sandals

loans.name: Mujeres Entusiastas Group

texts.es:
Doña Elda Fabiola es casada, tiene 33 años D. edad, cursó los estudios D. educación secundaria, tiene 2 hijos los cuales estan estudiando, se dedica al comercio, a la venta D. ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, inició cuando contaba con un poco D. capital y al momento lleva 5 años D. experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien tanbién se dedica al comercio.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo, que le servirá para ampliar su negocio; va a comprar mercaderia para la reventa: sueteres, blusas playeras, cancetines, bufandas, gorras, ropas para bebé, ropa íntima, etc. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a diversas actividades productivas: a la producción D. D. prendas D. vestir, al comercio minorista y al servicio D. tienda en general.
texts.en:
Elda Fabiola is 33 years old and married.  She completed high school and has two children who are currently in school.  Elda's business is selling ladies', men's and children's clothes.  She started her business with just a little capital and now she has five years experience.  She has the support of her husband who also buys and sells products.

Elda got together a group so that she could request a loan with which to expand her business.  She will buy merchandise for resale: sweaters, blouses, t-shirts, socks, scarves, caps, baby clothes, underwear, etc.  The other members of the group work in different businesses including: making clothes, selling products retail and running a store.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy lipsticks, nail polish, powders, creams, perfumes and treatments

loans.name: Aleyda Matilde

texts.es: Aleyda Matilde se dedica a ofrecer los servicios de billar y fritanga. Tiene más de 10 años a su cargo, es una persona muy responsable que disfruta de actividad económica. Ella tiene muchos clientes que llegan a buscar en su negocio un poco de diversión se siente pues ellos la conocen y saben que brinda un buen servicio. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de tacos, pelotas, mesas de billar entre otros productos.
texts.en: Aleyda Matilde's business is providing pool services and also fried food.  She has been in the business for more than ten years and she is a very responsible person who enjoys her work.  Aleyda has many customers who come to her business looking for a little entertainment.  They know her and they know that she provides a good service.  She is requesting this loan to buy pool cues, balls and tables, amongst other products.

loans.use: to buy pool cues, balls and tables, and other products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy medicines for resale

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime tiene  40 años de edad, vive en casa  junto a su esposa y sus 2 menores hijos.  Vive en el distrito de Cayalti aproximadamente a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo 

Jaime se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte público de personas de en una mototaxi (moto con cabina para transportar personas), unidad móvil que es de sus propiedad, con la cual recorre las principales calles de la ciudad de motupe y sus principales caseríos, Jaime cuenta con algunos años realizando esta actividad.

Jaime está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para realizar mantenimiento a su moto taxi y para el arreglo de la  parte exterior de su vivienda.

Jaime cuenta con muy buenas referencias comerciales, las personas que lo conocen lo describen como una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Jaime is 40 years of age and lives in a house with his wife and two minor children. He lives in the district of Cayalti approximately one hour from the city of Chiclayo. 

Jaime works providing public transportation services in a moto-taxi (motorcycle with a cabin for carrying people). The motor vehicle is his own property and with it he travels the primary streets of the city of Motupe and its main hamlets. Yoni has been in this business for a number of years. 

Jaime is seeking a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to provide maintenance to his moto-taxi and fix up the exterior of his home. 

Jaime has very good business references. The people who know him describe him as easy-going and responsible.

loans.use: to provide maintenance to his moto-taxi.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés es un padre de familia que tiene 38 años de edad, él vive con sus hijos los cuales son menores de edad.   Andrés vive en una comunidad la cual caracteriza a sus pobladores porque la mayoría son trabajadores independientes, que se dedican ala crianza y comercialización de animales. Andrés vive en un caserío que es anexo al distrito de Mórrope, con aproximadamente 50 familias 

Andrés se dedica principalmente a la compra y venta de pescado, esta actividad la realiza desde sus domicilio y recorriendo los distintos caseríos de Mórrope. Cuenta con una experiencia de 6 años trabajando en este rubro, los que e le han permitido adquirir experiencia y clientela fija para sus negocio. 
También se dedica a la comercialización de animales menores , negocio que realiza pero en menor intensidad.

Andrés está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles, para poder invertir en la compra de animales menores actualmente  se ha propuesto invertir en mayor cantidad de animales debido a que la demanda de comparadores de animales es alta por la zona y poder hacer arreglos al interior de su casa.

Andrés cuenta con buenas referencias, es un padre entregado a su trabajo muy responsable, y honesto, su más grande anhelo es poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Andrés, 38, is a father living with his children who are all minors.  He lives in a community known because most of its residents are independent workers who raise animals to sell.  Andrés lives in a hamlet that is annexed to Mórrope District and has about 50 families.

Andrés is primarily a fish merchant.  He carries out his activity from home traveling throughout the various hamlets in Mórrope.  He has six years experience in this line of work which has made it possible for him to acquire experience and a regular customer base.  He also sells small farm animals, a business he does but with less intensity.

Andrés is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 3000 new sol loan to buy small farm animals because he’s decided to invest in a larger quantity of animals because demand from buyers is high in the area and he’ll be able to do some improvements to the interior of his house.

Andrés has good references.  He is a father who is devoted to his work; he’s very responsible and honest.  His greatest wish is to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in his businesses and to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Lissette Del Carmen

texts.es: Lissette  del Carmen tiene cuarenta y tres años de edad. Su grupo familiar lo conforman: su mamá y dos hijos Carlos y Luis, quienes se encuentran estudiando;  mientras que Lissette en compañía de su mamá se dedican a su actividad productiva dentro de la panadería que tiene instalada en su misma casa de residencia;  ya son varios años de experiencia con los que cuenta dedicada a este negocio y los frutos que ello ha dejado son muchos, prueba de ello es que como madre soltera ha crecido sóla  a sus hijos y ayudado económicamente a su mamá, dándoles hogar digno, alimento y educación.  Ahora Lissette como todo emprendedor desea reinvertir aún más a su panadería dado que su pan francés y dulce está siendo mas demandado por su exquisito sabor, textura y tamaño, sin olvidar el precio accesible del mismo, su mayor deseo es ampliarse repartiendo el pan ya no sólo a sus vecinos cercanos quienes llegan a comprarlo a la puerta de su casa, sino que como su reconocimiento a lo largo de todo este tiempo es de que su pan es de muy buena calidad, desea hacerlo llegar a colonias vecinas tratando de generar a mayor volumen de ventas, mas ganancias y mejorar así la calidad de vida de todos los miembros del hogar y ofrecer a sus hijos una educación académica superior y que pueda ser esto lo que ella les herede . Por ello ha decidido solicitar a INTEGRAL un crédito con el que pueda comprar mayor cantidad de harina, levadura, huevos, mantecas, leche y azúcar del que normalmente usa.-
texts.en:
Lissette del Carmen is 43 years old.  Her family group consists of her mom and her two sons, Carlos and Luis, who are both in school.  Lissette and her mom work in a bakery which is located in their home.  They have years of experience in this business and the rewards that it has created are many.  Proof of this is that, although she is a single mother, Lissette has brought up her sons single handedly and also helped her mom financially, providing them with a decent home, food and education.

Like all entrepreneurs, Lissette would like to reinvest even more in her bakery since her French breads and sweet breads are becoming more and more in demand owing to their delicious flavor, texture and size, without forgetting their affordable price.

Lissette's biggest wish is to expand her business by providing her bread not only to her neighbors who come to her door to buy from her but, as it has become known over the years that her bread is very good quality, she would also like to deliver it to neighboring districts in order to generate more sales, more profits and, thereby, improve the quality of life of all her household members.  She would also like her children to go to college and for this to be her inheritance to them.  For this reason, she has decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL with which she can buy larger quantities of flour, yeast, eggs, butter, milk and sugar than she normally uses.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, eggs, butter, milk and sugar

loans.name: Ratana

texts.en:
Ratana is a fruit seller. He buys mangoes under contract from the villagers and sells thE. in the Phnom Penh market. His wife, Kolab runs a grocery store at home. Ratana hopes to continue his business, so he is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase mangoes for sale. 

The couple have been married since 2002 and has two children-one son and one daughter. One is in school and another one is still young. They live in a village along National Road Number One about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Photo: Ratana and his wife.

loans.use: To purchase mangos under contract for sale.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Sun is a 37 year-old businesswoman.    She buys all kinds of fish from domestic fisherman at a low price and then resells it at the local market in Siem Reap Province for a profit. From her selling business, Sun can earn about $3 per day to help support her family. In order to share responsibility with Sun, her husband works as a building construction worker and is making an income an average of US$5 each day. Every day, Sun uses her old bicycle to pick up the fish, but it is often late and she is not able to ride very far.  Mrs. Sun would like to ask for a loan to buy a used motorcycle to transport her fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle to transport her fish to sell.

loans.name: Tep

texts.en: The photograph shows Tep in front of her house in Siem Reap Province. Tep makes her daily revenue by sewing clothes to her neighbors and other villagers as well as working as a local farmer in the village. She is a widow with four children. Two of them are employed as workers in Thailand.  Tep will be using her loan to buy additional cloth in order to continue her sewing business. With this loan Tep hopes she can increase her income.

loans.use: to buy additional cloth in order to continue her sewing business.

loans.name: Oyungerel

texts.en: Oyungerel is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in the  Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. Her husband is a lama and her two children attend kindergarten. She manages a construction material trading business at a rented stall at a trading center called Margad. Oyungerel started her business after graduating her college in 2002. Now her business has been stabilized and she has many regular customers. She attributes her business success to the  good location of her store. She is planning to expand her business in the future. Oyungerel is a patient woman who says, "I want to broaden the variety of my products in order to attract more customers." She is requesting a MNT 3,000,000  loan to purchase more construction material to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more construction material to sell

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 43 year old woman with 4 children. With 4 children in school, Josefa works very hard to provide for them.

Josefa runs a cosmetic business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Josefa has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as lotion, lipstick, perfume, etc..

In the future Josefa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 65 years old and a widow with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Lucia runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines. She has been running the store for 40 years. She has requested a 15,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her store.

Lucia has borrowed and paid back 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La señora Julia se dedica a elaborar y vender comida en su domicilio desD. hace mas D. seis años, la actividad es familiar ya que para la elaboración y posterior venta le ayudan sus hijos quienes a pesar D. estar estudiando en la universidad se sacan tiempo para colaborar a su mama, la señora Julia vive en domicilio D. su propiedad con sus dos hijos, también cuenta con una tienda D. barrio donD. atienD. desD. las seis D. la mañana hasta las diez D. la noche, solicita el crédito para mejorar su puesto D. venta con la compra D. mas mesas y sillas para brindar una buena atención a sus clientes, el deseo D. la Sra. Julia es el D. ver a sus hijos profesionales y hombres D. bien, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Julia's business is making and selling food in her home.  She has been doing this for more than six years.  It is a family business since her children help her make and sell the food.  In spite of the fact that they are studying at university, they make time to help their mom.

Julia lives in her own home together with her two children.  She also has a neighborhood store where she works from 6.00am to 10.00pm.  She is requesting this loan to improve her sales location by purchasing more table and chairs, so that she can proviD. her customers with a good service.  Julia's wish is to see her children become professionals and good, hard-working people.  She is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her business

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Mrs Sun, 38, is a low-income person in Siem Reap Province. She is a good and determined single mother who tries to feed her three children, even though she is recently divorced from her husband. 

She has one daughter who is employed as a temporary worker and her other children attend the local school. 

Mrs Sun sells fresh fish in the market. Every morning, she goes to a place where fishermen sell fish in bulk. Then she hurries to bring the fish in and sells the fish around her village. 

Mrs Sun would like a $200 loan to purchase bamboo to produce traps to catch fish.

loans.use: to buy bamboo to produce traps for catching fish.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita, 33 years old, is married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur, running a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years.

Rosita has requested a 15,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell on her food stall.

In the future, Rosita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell on her food stall.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Avelino

texts.en:
Avelino is 59 years old and married with five adult-aged children. He earns about 50,000 PHP per crop as a farmer working in the Philippines. He has been growing corn for the past 39 years.

Avelino is asking for a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and corn seed for his four hectare field. He will also use the loan to pay for the preparation of his fields.

Avelino dreams that someday his farm will be profitable enough to lift his family’s living situation and to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and corn seed and to pay for preparation of his fields.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en: Estelita is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. To earn a living, Estelita has a business selling coconut wines, snacks & vegetables. She earns about PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. Estelita has a requested a loan to buy snack foods, canned goods & biscuits. Estelita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Estelita would like to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, canned goods & biscuits

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a hardworking Filipina entrepreneur who has had a motorcycle transport business for the past seventeen years. She also farms sugarcane, has a general store and fattens pigs.

Agnes has been sustaining her businesses through her own effort and with the help of loans from NWTF. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase spare parts to maintain her motorcycle.

Agnes dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to maintain her motorcycle.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong, 50, is a village woman living in Dongkor commune, a part of Phnom Penh. Since 2006 she has been selling a variety of merchandise from home.

Kong is a widow. She has three single children; two are employed, one as a hairdresser and the other as a casual construction worker.

Kong also has a son who is not yet working. She would like to help him get work, but she has no cash to make that possible. So Kong would like to request a loan to purchase a used motor-trailer taxi for him.

loans.use: to purchase a used motor-trailer taxi for her son to begin a service business.

loans.name: Buyanravjih

texts.en:
Buyanravjih is a 63-year-old widow who lives in a rented house in the province of Uvurhangai in Mongolia. All of her children have grown up and live separately. In 2000, Buyanravjih started a grocery trading business at a rented stall in the Zanabazar trading center and has gained much experience, managing to build a strong customer base and expand her operation. She has also developed long-term and transparent relationships with her partners and suppliers.

A hardworking and honest woman who is planning to continue her business in the future, Buyanravjih says, "I want to build savings with the earnings I make." She is now requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more grocery products to increase her business sales.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products.

loans.name: Khov

texts.en:
Khov is twenty years old and a resident of the Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap province. She has a single child and a life partner in her husband who is a meatball seller in the mobile place.

Since 2009 Khov has been planting rice and a few types of fruit to sell. She also sells some vegetables in the market for extra income. She is able to earn a profit of around $2 a day to use for her family’s expenses such as food, utilities and other necessary expenditures.

Khov would like a loan to purchase more vegetables to sell and additional meatballs for her husband’s business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell and additional meatballs for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Dugersuren

texts.en:
Dugersuren is 49 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger, or Mongolian yurt, in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife is a teacher, and his younger two children, ages 14 and 17, go to a local secondary school. His oldest son who is 22 years old graduated from college recently.

Dugersuren manages an auto parts business at a local market. He started his business in 2011 after managing a raw materials trading company for three years. Nowadays, auto parts businesses are popular. Therefore, he decided to start his own so that he can earn much more money than before.

Dugersuren is a reliable and trusted loan recipient of Xacbank, the biggest microfinance bank in Mongolia. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase auto parts in order to increase his business sales. He is a diligent man who says, "I want to expand my business in order to increase savings for my family."

loans.use: to purchase auto parts.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Pen, 26 years old, is a humble villager living in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She is married and blessed with four children, while her husband is a construction worker. Pen sells lotus flowers which she either grows or buys in bulk from her supplier. Her husband always picks up the flowers for her before he goes to work. The family normally earns an average of $6 per day to help cover their family’s daily living expenses. To meet the needs of her family, Pen is applying for a loan with which she will buy some piglets for breeding so she can sell them when they are grown.

loans.use: to buy piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Pheap, pictured here with her loom, runs a weaving business. She hopes to build and strengthen this business, since it is a traditional profession at which she is skilled. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of $300 USD in order to purchase weaving materials.

Pheap is a widow with two sons and a daughter. All of her children are in school. The family lives in a village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Horoldavaa

texts.en:
Horoldavaa is 27 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger, or Mongolian yurt, in Uvurhangai, a province of Mongolia. His two children who haven't reached school age stay home. He is a hardworking man who says, "I want to buy a car with my earnings."

Horoldavaa manages a cell phone repair business that he established in 2005 in his town. Now he has many regular customers and is planning to continue his business. He is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase cell phone parts.

loans.use: to purchase cell phone parts.

loans.name: Myagmarbaatar

texts.en:
Myagmardorj is 35 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger, or Mongolian yurt, in Uvurhangai province in Mongolia. His wife is a salesperson, and two of his children attend the local secondary school. He also has to pay for his older son's treatment costs every year.

Myagmardorj manages a raw materials trading company in his town. He started his business in 2009 after working as an assistant for flour traders. In doing this work he gained much knowledge on business administration and accounting. Therefore he started his own business in order to earn more money to feed his family.

Myagmardorj is a hardworking man who attributes his business success to his good managerial skills. He is planning to expand and continue in his work. He is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to purchase additional inventory for his business. He says, "In the future I want my son to be healthy and have a better life."

loans.use: to purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle to provide taxi service and to be used for commuting

loans.name: Lon

texts.en:
Lon earns an income by offering chickens and ducks for sale in her local community. She hopes to continue expanding her business, so she is applying for a loan in the amount of $400 to buy additional chickens and ducks to offer for sale.

Lon is a widow with two sons and two daughters. She lives in a village aL. National Road Number Six, about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: to buy additional chickens and ducks to offer for sale

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Erlinda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & eggs. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks & breads. Erlinda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & breads

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida is 63 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Leonida has a shop that sells canned goods, biscuits, candies, chocolate & milk powdered drinks. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Leonida is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Leonida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, candies & snacks

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Nora has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & biscuits. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional snacks & canned goods.
Nora is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Nora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional canned goods, snacks, shampoo & detergents

loans.name: Ley's Group

texts.en:
This is a group of five low-income people who have decided to seek a loan together, and each member of the group will use his or her loan for similar purposes. Mrs. Ley, age 32, was chosen to be the leader of this loan group by the other members. 

Mrs. Ley and her husband earn an income through fisH.. They usually spend eight hours a day fisH. in the local river. They catch around 10 kilos of fish per day and sell these in bulk to their customers, who are retail fish vendors at the market. The couple has two children who are still enrolled in school. Mrs. Ley will use her loan to purchase nets in order to increase the daily fisH. yield for herself and her husband.

The other four people in the loan group are also fisherfolk. Mrs. Eng is requesting a loan in order to buy a new boat. The remaining three, including a couple named Mr. and Mrs. Eang, are requesting loans to purchase fisH. nets.

loans.use: to purchase nets in order to increase her daily fishing yield

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. Erlinda has a shop that sells canned goods & snacks. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Erlinda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Lilybeth

texts.en: Lilybeth is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Lilybeth is making and selling coconut charcoal. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy coconut shells to make coconut charcoal. Lilybeth is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lilybeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconut shells to make coconut charcoal

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Gloria has a retail shop where she sells vegetables, spices & food seasonings. She has had this business for 24 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy vegetables & food seasonings. Gloria is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Gloria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables & food seasonings

loans.name: Buenadelia

texts.en: Buenadelia is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Buenadelia has a retail shop that sells tin made products like kitchen sinks & kitchen utensils. She has had this business for 34 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw materials needed to make the tin utensils. Buenadelia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Buenadelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed to make tin utensils

loans.name: Darwin

texts.en: Darwin, age 19 and unmarried, is a farmer living and working in the Philippines. Darwin has been growing corn for five years. He is requesting a loan of PHP 35,000 in order to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, as well as to buy corn seeds to be planted on 2.0 hectares of his farm. He wants to maintain and strengthen his business in the future, and wants to help lift his parents to a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, as well as to buy corn seeds for planting

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: Jenny is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Jenny has a retail shop where she sells beauty & personal products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy beauty & personal use products from NATASHA & AVON. Jenny is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Jenny hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy beauty & personal use products to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. Erlinda has a meat shop where she sells roasted pig & meats like pork & beef. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additonal pigs for her butcher shop. In the picture is Erlinda and her stock house for the fire wood used in cooking letchon or roasted pig. Erlinda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additonal pigs to roast and sell

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en: Elenita is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Elenita has a retail shop where she sells beverages, coconut wines & snacks. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additonal stocks of beverages. Elenita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Elenita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additonal stocks of beverages

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto has been engaged in farming for 10 years in the Philippines. Currently, he earns PHP 20,000 for each crop he harvests. Alberto desires eventually to expand his farmland so as to provide an extra source of income for the family. He and his wife have three grown children.  

Alberto is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 in order to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, as well as to buy hybrid seeds of corn to be planted on the family farm. Alberto is confident that this loan will make his operations more productive.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, as well as to buy hybrid seeds of corn for planting

loans.name: Menchela

texts.en: Menchela is 19 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Menchela has a food shop where she sells fruits like coconuts & mangoes. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of vegetables & fruits. Menchela is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Menchela hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of vegetables & fruits

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia, age 57, is a farmer living and working in the Philippines. She has planted and harvested corn for 15 years. For additional income, she is also engaged in a retailing business, specifically a general store. Her husband is also a farmer. They have five grown children.

Celia is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 in order to purchase fertilizers (such as manure) as well as to buy hybrid corn seeds to be planted on her farm. She wants to maintain and strengthen her business so that she can continue to help provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers (such as manure) as well as to buy hybrid corn seeds for planting

loans.name: Almeda

texts.en: Almeda is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Almeda has a retail shop that sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of blouses, t-shirts & beauty products. Almeda is new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Almeda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more blouses, t-shirts & beauty products to sell

loans.name: Menchelle

texts.en: Menchelle is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. Menchelle has a food shop that sells & serves viands like afritada, caldereta & chicken & pork adobo. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients like meat, spices & vegetables. Menchelle is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Menchelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like meat, spices & vegetables

loans.name: Zoila

texts.en:
Zoila is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.  Zoila has a food shop that sells afritada, caldereta & chicken adobo.
She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients like vegetables, spices & meat. Zoila is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Zoila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like vegetables, spices & meat

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Angelita has a retail shop that sells clothing like t-shirts, blouses & underwear. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of blouses & underwear. Angelita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Angelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more blouses & underwear to sell

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha, age 37, is a farmer and a homemaker living and working in the Philippines. Editha's husband is also a farmer. They have one school-aged child.

Editha is asking for a loan that she will use  to buy inputs needed in their field, such as fertilizers (like manure), seeds of corn, and pesticides. In the future, Editha hopes that her business will bring in a higher income from the yields so as to better meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers (like manure), seeds of corn for planting, and pesticides

loans.name: Viateur

texts.fr: Viateur est client d’ACB depuis 2010. Il est célibataire  âge de 30 ans.  Il est né au  Rwanda. Il est sentinelle d’une église locale et il est en même temps étudiant dans l’option mécanique  automobile. C’est son cinquième cycle de prêt avec ACB et il a eu bon historique de remboursement. Il va utiliser le prêt pour payer son minerval. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire  est d’étudier avec courage et terminer avec distinction en classe. Dans l’avenir il voudrait termine ses études en mécanique et cherche le permis de conduire et pouvoir fonder son propre foyer.
texts.en: Viateur has been a client of ACB since 2010. He is a single man aged 30. He was born in Rwanda. He is a security guard at a local church, and he also studies to become an auto mechanic. This is his fifth loan cycle with ACB, and he has a good payment history. He will use the loan to buy his tuition fees. His strategy is to persevere with in his studies and graduate on top of his class. In the future he would like to become a mechanic, obtain a driver’s license and be able to start his own family.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Kajik

texts.en: Kajik is engaged in agriculture.  He needs to supply forage for his livestock. He plans to do haying which requires a grass cutting machine. He also would like to hire workers to help him with haying. With the loan’s help, Kajik will earn income and also provide forage for his cattle. The income generation is absolutely vital for Kajik and his family, a wife and two children.

loans.use: to buy a grass cutting machine and hire workers.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en: Yvonne is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. Yvonne has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, beverages, biscuits & breads. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Yvonne is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Yvonne hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Lea

texts.en: Lea is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Lea has a retail shop that sells her homemade beauty soaps. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy ingredients to make the beauty soaps. Lea is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lea hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make beauty soap

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is selling and setting up heating systems. He works from a rented shop. Armen's shop provides services to a large number of customer groups, so he constantly needs to refresh his product variety. He would like to enlarge his business and increase his working capital.

With the requested loan, he plans to increase the variety of his products. Armen lives together with his wife, father and one child, and the business profit sustains the whole family.

loans.use: to pay for products for the shop

loans.name: Seyran

texts.en:
Seyran is engaged in an agricultural business. He cultivates land, processes the agricultural products and sells them.  He would like to cultivate more land and develop his agriculture further.

With the loan’s help, Seyran will purchase wheat, make flour and sell it, thus increasing the income for his young and growing family. Seyran lives together with his wife and little daughter.

loans.use: to pay for wheat

loans.name: Thor

texts.en:
Thor, age 37, is a rice farmer. Rice cultivation has been a part of her daily routine for many years. Rice is a critical product vital to the Cambodian people, and she learned her farming skills from her grandmother. She is widely known and trusted in this sector since before she was married. Her husband, Noun, is employed as a secondary school teacher in his community, Kompong Cham Province. 

The couple has decided to start a new business whereby Noun will offer motorcycle taxi and transport services in their local community. Thor will therefore be using her loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband, so that he can begin to operate a motor taxi service.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her husband, so that he can begin to operate a motor taxi service

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta, age 44, earns a living by running a general store, where she sells both food items and daily-use products in her local community. Marieta has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,560 PHP a month. She and her husband have four school-aged children and live in the city of Mobod, Oroq. City. 

In 2010, Marieta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Marieta has successfully repaid her most recent previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Marieta is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional food products, such as bags of rice and corn grits, to offer for sale. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Marieta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional food products, such as bags of rice and corn grits, to offer for sale

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak is engaged in an agricultural business. He keeps livestock and cultivates land. He would like to develop his business by increasing his livestock and cultivating more land. With the requested loan, he plans to purchase sheep, special sorts of potato seeds and fertilizer.

With the loan’s help, Artak will increase his working capital and expand his business further. He lives together with his wife, pensioner mother, son and daughter.

loans.use: to pay for sheep, special sorts of potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Silver

texts.en:
Silver, age 45, is a farmer living and working in the Philippines. He has planted and harvested corn for 25 years and earns approximately PHP 30,000 per cropping season. Silver is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers (like manure) and hybrid corn seeds to be planted on his farm. 

Silver and his wife have three school-aged children. He wishes to maintain and strengthen his business in future so as to further meet his family's needs and to allow his children to pursue their education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers (like manure) and hybrid corn seeds for planting

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is from the town of Maular, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. He is 34 years old. Joy is married and has two school-aged children. Joy owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling  food & daily use products in the local community. Joy has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 3000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2010, Joy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to do business. Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Joy is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional grocery items for sale. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Joy from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. 

About GDMPC: 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for sale

loans.name: Nyura

texts.en:
Nyura is trading in men’s clothing from a rented booth at the city market. She wishes to sell more clothes and enlarge her business. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase clothing and increase the trade.

With the loan’s help, she will get more income and will be able to meet her big family’s needs. Nyura lives together with her pensioner husband, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren.

loans.use: to pay for clothing

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 41-year-old married man and father of four lovely children. He has owned a grocery store since 1996. He is well known in the region and most of his clients are from the village. Ali is a hard worker, he does so in order to provide a secure and healthy life for his family. 

Ali has had four loans from Al Majmoua (a Kiva partner) and is a borrower in good standing. All his previous loans had a good impact on his business and family's social and financial situation. 

Currently he is requesting a loan in order to increase his business capital with summer special offers on soft drinks and ice cream. 

He hopes to improve his business more and more and to own a big Internet cafe in the future.

loans.use: To increase his summer season's capital through offers such as soft drinks and ice cream

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is from the city of Villaflor, Oroquieta City. She is 57 years old. Nena is married and has six adult children. Nena owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food & daily use products in the local community. Nena has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2007, Nena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Nena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Nena is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional grocery products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Nena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC: 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: to purchase additional grocery products to sell

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is from the town of Barra Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Caroline is single and has two adult children.

Caroline has a general store that sells food & daily use products in her community. Caroline has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 14,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2011, Caroline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Caroline is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like soft drinks and rice for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Caroline from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

loans.use: to purchase additional products like soft drinks and rice for sale

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:

She has a store that sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste to the local community. Nenita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2011, Nenita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase rice and corn grits for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nenita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About GDMPC: 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn grits for resale

loans.name: Aileen Mae

texts.en:
Aileen Mae is from the town of Palayan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Aileen Mae is married and has one school-aged child. Aileen Mae has a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food & daily use products in the local community. Aileen Mae has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 6000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2011, Aileen Mae joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business.  Aileen Mae is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, and beverages for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Aileen Mae from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About GDMPC: 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, and beverages for sale

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is 31 and a single mother of two children. She sells second-hand bedding, a business she has been in for three years. The business earns her a monthly income of 12,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

This is her third loan from KADET Ltd. and she has successfully repaid her previous loans. She will use the loan funds to buy more bedsheets for resale. 

Magdaline will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy used bedsheets for resale

loans.name: Gyulnara

texts.en:
Gyulnara is trading in women’s clothing from a rented booth in one of the city’s markets. She would like to develop her business through refreshing the clothing stock.

With the loan’s help, she will be able to continue doing her business successfully. The income from this retail business is the main source of income for her and her pensioner husband.

loans.use: to pay for clothing

loans.name: Elezabeth

texts.en:
Elezabeth is from the town of Mohon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 and married. Elezabeth has a business selling handicrafted items, such as items made from nipa palm leaves. Elezabeth has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2011, Elezabeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Elezabeth is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials for manufacturing woven nipa. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elezabeth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About GDMPC: 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
