loans.name: Stanislas

texts.en:
Stanislas, age 29 and married, has owned a motorcycle transport business for the past year. His business is well-organized and open daily from 6 a.m. until 9 p.m. 

Stanislas has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy essential materials like tires and an engine for his motorcycle transport. With his profits, he plans to reinvest in his business and to save for his future.

loans.use: To buy essential materials like tires and an engine.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio is from the town of Lumbayao, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. He is 43 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. 

Gregorio has a general store in which he sells food & daily use products. He has been in this business for over 11 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2011, Gregorio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to do business. He is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase bagoong (fish paste) and dried fish for sale. 

This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gregorio from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to his house. 

About GDMPC: 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase bagoong and dried fish for sale

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Mrs. Phat is a 44-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Cham Province. Mrs. Phat is married to Mr. Horn, age 54. This couple, who work together in the rice-planting business, have a child who works in the farming business as well. 

Because the rainy season is approaching, Mrs. Phat wants to grow more crops on her own farmland. As she lacks the money to do this, Mrs. Phat has decided to request a loan from Kiva. Mrs. Phat will use these funds to plant corn and sesame.

loans.use: to plant corn and sesame.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita, age 48, runs a used clothing store, selling second-hand clothing items to members of her local community. Marianita has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. She is widowed and has five school-aged children. The family lives in the  village of Pob. 2, Oroq. City. 
 
In 2008, Marianita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Marianita has successfully repaid her most recent previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Marianita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional used clothing products to offer for sale. This loan will be the third taken out by Marianita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is engaged in agriculture. He keeps livestock and an orchard. He lives together with his mother. His father passed a few years ago. The son inherited the farm and the fruit orchard, and thanks to his hard work, managed to increase the business. 

He wishes to increase the livestock and develop his business further. The increased income will allow Simon to create better living conditions and create his own family in the future.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Nikolay

texts.en:
Nikolay produces and sells sweets from a rented booth at the market. He lives together with his parents, who help him in business, his wife and two children. 

He would like to increase the variety of products and meet his clients' demands. 

With the requested loan, he plans to purchase more sweets for sale. Increased sales will help him increase his working capital and enlarge his business further.

loans.use: to pay for sweets.

loans.name: Katiereton 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe KATIERETON 2 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 49 ans, 7 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Nimprodioula un des villages de la commune de Sikasso, (3ème région  administrative du Mali). 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution et le prêt passé a été bien  remboursé.
Les spéculations cultivées par ce groupe d’homme  sont généralement  le maïs    tes avec KALIFA SIBIRI. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, il compte acheter des intrants ( engrais et herbicides), les petits matériels pour entretien des champs. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village et au marché de Sikasso après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
 KALIFA SIBIRI compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 110 000 FCFA par campagne et souhaite entretenir sa collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso. 
Il ambitionne de construire une maison à usage d’habitation dans l’avenir.
texts.en:
The members of the Katiereton 2  group are married men who are on average 49 years old and have an average of 7 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Nimprodioula, one of the villages in the Sikasso community, (third administrative region of Mali)
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to carry their agricultural activities through the winter.
This is their third loan with the institution and the previous loan was repaid correctly.
The crops grown by this group of men are usually corn,like Kalifa Sibiri.
With this new loan, he plans to purchase products for the earth (fertiliser and weed killer), and small tools for the maintenance of his fields.
After the harvest the produce is sold in the village and at the market in Sikasso to men and women customers.
Kalifa Sibiri hopes to make an average profit of 110 000 FCFA for each field and wishes to continue his cooperation with Soro Yiriwaso.
His aim is  to build a house for residence in the future.

loans.use: pay for fertiliser ,weed killer, and small farming equipment.

loans.name: Sirush

texts.en:
Sirush is engaged in farming. She lives together with her husband, a veteran of two wars – Afghanistan and Nagorno Karabakh. Although the husband lost his leg during the last war, he actively helps his wife. 

Sirush plans to build a greenhouse with drip irrigation and increase the livestock. She also would like to purchase special milk storage containers to store milk until milk collection from their village.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse and buy more livestock and milk containers.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, age 18, has worked in manufacturing aluminum since 2005. Ali was very young when he started in this business, but it was necessary for him to work because of his parents' rough financiA. situation. Ali left school after the third Intermediate level. He tells us that he cannot say whether or not he misses school since he considers his family's needs to be his first priority.
 
Ali is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua for the first time. With it, he plans to expand his business by addng a glass work department. This is the first step in moving toward his planned future business, which will involve specializing in windows and kitchen closets as well as storefront displays. Ali is confident that this expansion will offer considerable value to his customers and will allow him to take another step toward his eventuA. future business.

loans.use: to expand his business by addng a glass work department

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en:
Speciose is 50 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 5 and 14. 

She sells goods such as sorghum and beans. She has five years of experience in her business and works from 7 a.m. until 9 p.m. every day except Saturday. Speciose currently employs two people to help her. 

Speciose has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand the inventory of her goods (beans and sorghum). With the profits, Speciose will reinvest in her business, pay school fees for her children, and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of sorghum and beans.

loans.name: Lansar Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité LANSAR est créé depuis le 12 mai 2010; il est composé de seize femmes qui habitent ensemble et mènent comme activité principale le petit commerce.



Madame Sarakh la responsable est âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée mère de deux enfants mais a également en charge quatre petits enfants qui sont orphelins de mère. 

Elle mène comme activité principale le petit commerce de légumes et poisson et fait parallèlement de la vente de viande cuite en collaboration avec son mari. Sur la photo, elle est debout à droite habillée d'un sari bleu.


Elle achète ses légumes, poisson, moutons et chèvres au marché hebdomadaire du village et y revend également. Elle a une expérience de 20 ans dans ce domaine.


Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter des moutons et chèvres à abattre pour la cuisson surtout les mercredi qui sont jour de marché hebdomadaire afin de satisfaire la clientèle qui vient de tous les horizons.



Elle souhaite avec ses bénéfices augmenter son épargne et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille pour la nourriture, la scolarité et la santé.
texts.en:
The solidarity group called LANSAR was created on May 12, 2010 and is composed of 16 women who live in the same area and whose principal work is the sale of small items. 

Madame Sarakh, the leader of the group, is 47. She is married and the mother of two children, but is also raising four young children whose mother is deceased.

Her principal activity is selling vegetables and fish. At the same time she sells cooked meat together with her husband. In the photo, she is standing on the right, dressed in a blue sari. 

She buys vegetables, fish, sheep and goats at the weekly market in the village and resells her goods in the same place. She has 20 years' experience in this field. Her loan will allow her to  buy sheep and goats to slaughter and cook,especially on Wednesdays, the weekly market day, so as to satisfy the demand of customers who come from all over. 

She hopes that she can use her profit to grow her savings and improve living conditions for her family in terms of food, school fees, and health-related issues.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fish for resale.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 38 years old and is married with two children, 3 and 7 years old. She sells milk in her boutique. Her business is well-organized. Judith has two years' experience in her business and she works from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m. every day.

She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more quantity of milk to sell. With her profit, Judith will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To increase her business by buying more milk to sell.

loans.name: Takku Liggey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Takku Liggey est créé le 12 mai 2010 il en est à son troisième cycle; il est composé de neuf femmes qui mènent des activités de petit commerce et de coiffure.



La responsable Madame YAWMA est est âgée de 24ans elle divorcée sans enfant. Elle gère un salon de coiffure qu'elle a ouvert avec son premier financement. Sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en marron orange et a levé la main gauche.

Elle a une bonne expérience car elle a su très tôt faire des tresses et différentes coiffures pour dames. Les financements obtenus l'ont aidé à mieux s'équiper et rendre agréable son lieu de travail en achetant des chaises,un tapis, un miroir et autres accessoires de coiffure.

Son prêt lui servira à acheter des mèches pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et gagner plus de revenus.

Avec les bénéfices obtenus, elle paie la location et aide sa grande sœur avec qui elle vit dans la gestion de la maison.Elle s'occupe également de ses besoins et souhaite renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group called Takku Liggey was created on May 12, 2010. It is composed of nine women who have small businesses or do hairdressing. 

The group leader,  Madame YAWMA, is 24 and divorced with no children.  She manages a beauty shop that she was able to open using her first loan. In the photo, she is the person standing on the right, dressed in chestnut and orange, raising her left hand. 

She has a good deal of experience as she learned early on to do braids and various hairstyles for ladies. The loans she has received have helped her to buy equipment and make her workplace pleasant, buying chairs, a carpet, a mirror, and other beauty salon accessories. 

This loan will allow her to buy hair extensions so as to better satisfy her clientele and earn more money. With her earnings, she pays rent and helps her older sister, with whom she lives, with household expenses. She supports herself and hopes to put aside more in savings.

loans.use: To buy materials for her beauty shop.

loans.name: Katiereton 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe KATIERETON 3 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans, 9 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Nimprodioula un des villages de la commune de Sikasso, (3ème région  administrative du Mali). 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution et le prêt passé a été bien  remboursé.
Les spéculations cultivées par ce groupe d’hommes  sont généralement  le maïs  avec SOUNGALO. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, il compte acheter des intrants ( engrais et herbicide) et les petits matériels agricoles. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village et au marché de Sikasso après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
SOUNGALO compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 115 000 FCFA par campagne et souhaite entretenir  sa collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso.
Son ambition est d’acheter un vélo  pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
The members of the group called KATIERETON 3 are married men with an average age of 50 and nine children, and most live in polygamous families in Nimprodioula, one of the villages making up the township of Sikasso, (third administrative region of Mali). They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to be able to farm successfully during the rainy season. This is their second time working with the institution and their prior loan was correctly reimbursed. 

The crop cultivated by this group of men is generally maize, as is the case with Soungalo. With this new loan he intends to buy agricultural entrants (fertilizer and herbicide) and small agricultural tools. The crops are sold after harvest, both in the village and at the Sikasso market, to a clientele composed of men and women. 

Soungalo expects to make an average profit of 115,000 F CFA per harvest and hopes to continue his collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso. His ambition is to buy a bicycle for his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, small agricultural tools, and herbicides.

loans.name: Seydina  Mohamed Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité Seydina Mohamed est créé depuis le 12 mai 2010. Il est composé de huit femmes qui habitent le même  quartier. Elles ont comme activités principales le petit commerce et l'embouche.

Madame Awa la responsable est âgée de 44 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants mais a en charge deux autres qui lui sont confiés par des proches. Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en sari multicolore et a levé la main droite.

Elle mène une activité d'embouche et fait parallèlement de la restauration. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ces secteurs d'activités. 

Awa s'approvisionne au marché hebdomadaire du village en moutons, aliments pour bétails et en tous les condiments nécessaires à la restauration. Elle revend ses moutons au même lieu après les avoir engraissés en trois ou six mois. La restauration marche beaucoup pendant les jours de marché hebdomadaire.

Avec son prêt elle souhaite augmenter son cheptel en achetant plus de moutons mais aussi de l'aliment pour les nourrir. Ceci lui permettra de faire plus de bénéfices. 

Ses bénéfices lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille en nourriture et habillement et aider ainsi son mari. Elle compte à l'avenir acheter des bœufs pour l'embouche si elle parvient à obtenir toujours des financements de Caurie.
texts.en:
The Seydina Mohamed Solidarity group was created on the 12th May 2010.It is made up of eight women who live in the same neighbourhood. Their main activities are small businesses and the fattening of livestock.

Mrs Awa, the leader is 44 years old. She is married and mother to three children but also cares for two others who are entrusted to her by family and friends. In the photograph she is standing on the right, dressed in a multicoloured sari with her right hand raised.

She runs a livestock fattening business and at the same time does catering .She has a lot of experience in these activities.

Awa buys her stock of sheep, animal feed, and all the condiments necessary for her catering at the weekly market in the village. She resells her sheep at the same place having fattened them up for three or six months. The restaurant trade is much brisker on market days.

With her loan she wishes to increase her herd of livestock by purchasing more sheep but also more animal feed .This will enable her a make better profit.

Her profits enable her to pay for the family needs in food and clothing and thus help her husband. In the future she intends to purchase some oxen for fattening if she still manages to obtain loans from Caurie

loans.use: purchase sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Nadiegueton 3 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe NADIEGUETON 3 est constitué de cinq hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 4  enfants et vivant  dans des  familles polygames à Flazambougou un des villages de la commune de Sikasso et situé à environ 12 km de Sikasso ville, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé a été bien  remboursé.
La spéculation  principale cultivée est le maïs.  
BREHIMA,  compte acheter, avec son prêt, des 200 kg d’engrais, 4 bidons d’herbicides ,  les petits matériels et payer les frais de désherbage d’ entretiens . 
La production est vendue après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au niveau du village, au marché  de Sikasso . 
BREHIMA  compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 90 000FCFA par campagne. Son bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et  de réaliser les évènements sociaux de la famille.
Il souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso et son partenaire KIVA afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The Nadiegueton 3 group is composed of five married men who are on average 43 years old with four children. They live in polygamous families in Flazambougou, one of the villages in Sikasso township, located about 8 miles from the city of Sikasso, Mali's third administrative region.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to complete their agricultural activities during wintering. They are on their third loan with the organization, previous loans having been repaid correctly.
The main cultivar in which they deal is corn.
With his loan, Brehima plans on purchasing 200 kilos of fertilizer, 4 cans of herbicide, and small equipment; it will also pay for routine weeding expenses.
Production is sold after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women, at the village level, at the Sikasso market.
Brehima plans on making an average benefit of 90,000 CFA per cultivation cycle. His benefits will allow him to pay back his loan and to carry out the family's social events.
He wishes to maintain this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso and its partner Kiva in order to operate an even larger cultivation space, the better to increase his profits.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural supplies and labor costs.

loans.name: Nadiegueton 4 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Nadiegueton 4 est constitué de cinq hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 3  enfants et vivant  dans des  familles polygames à Flazambougou un des villages de la commune de Sikasso et situé à environ 12 km de Sikasso ville, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé a été bien  remboursé.
La spéculation  principale cultivée est le maïs.  
AGUIBOU,  compte acheter, avec son prêt, des 200 kg d’engrais, 4 bidons d’herbicides ,  les petits matériels et payer les frais de désherbage d’ entretiens . 
La production est vendue après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au niveau du village, au marché  de Sikasso . 
AGUIBOU compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100. 000FCFA par campagne. Son bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et  de réaliser les évènements sociaux de la famille.
Il souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso et son partenaire KIVA afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The Nadiegueton 4 group is composed of five married men, averaging 40 years of age, with three children and living in polygamous families in Flazambougou, a village in the Skiasso community, about 12 km from the town of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their agricultural activities during the winter season. They are on their third loan with the institution. The past loan has been well repaid. The main produce is corn.

Aguibou pland to use his loan to buy 200 kg of fertilizers, four jugs of herbicides, tools and pay for the cost of weeding labor. After harvesting, the produce is sold to men and women from their village and at the Sikasso market.

Aguibou plans to achieve a monthly income of 100,000 West African francs per agricultural cycle. His income will allow him to pay off his loan and cover the cost of big family events. 

He would like to continue this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso and its partner Kiva in order to cultivate a larger land plot and be able to  increase his income.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural inputs, small tools and cost of manual labor

loans.name: Dableni Ton Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe DABLENI TON sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivant dans des  familles polygames à  LOBOUGOULA, chef lieu de la dite commune, préfecture de Sikasso, (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution et les prêts passés ont été bien  remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée par ce groupe d’homme  est le maïs.
 Avec ce nouveau prêt, DANAYA qui est le président du groupe, compte payer les frais de labour, acheter de l’engrais et de l’herbicide. 
Les productions du groupe sont vendues au niveau du village et au marché de Sikasso après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
DANAYA   compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 120 000 par campagne qui sera utilisé pour  prendre en charge les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The seven members of the group called DABLENI TON are married men with an average age of 40 and five children. They live in polygamous families in LOBOUGOULA, seat of the township of the same name, in Sikasso prefecture. (third administrative region of Mali.) 

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to succeed in their agricultural pursuits during the rainy season. This is their third collaboration with the institution and their prior loans have been correctly reimbursed. The crop they grow is maize. 

With this new loan, DANAYA, who is the president of this group, intends to pay plowing expenses and buy fertilizer and herbicide. Their crops are sold after harvest in the village and also at the Sikasso market to a clientele composed of men and women. 

DANAYA  hopes to make an average profit of 120,000 per season, which will be used to cover family needs.

loans.use: to pay plowing expenses and buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Sop Sën Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est composé de onze femmes issues du même quartier. il est créé depuis le 12 mai 2010. Les principales activités menées par les femmes sont le petit commerce et l'embouche.

Madame Souda est âgée de 30 ans, mariée elle a sept enfants en charge dont un neveu orphelin de père. Elle est debout à droite de la photo habillée en bleu clair, couverte d'un châle bleu et à levé la main gauche. 

Elle Fait de l'embouche mais à côté elle mène un petit commerce de divers produits alimentaires.

Elle achète des moutons sur place dans les marchés hebdomadaires et les revend au même endroit après trois à six mois d'embouche. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.

Avec son prêt elle souhaite acheter d'autres moutons pour augmenter son cheptel et ainsi se faire beaucoup d'argent aux prochaines ventes; car en fin de cycle elle en vend pour rembourser son prêt.

Elle souhaite augmenter son épargne avec les bénéfices obtenus. Elle participe aux dépenses de la famille pour soutenir son mari à mieux s'occuper des enfants.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is composed of 11 women who come from the same neighborhood. It was created on May 12, 2010. The primary businesses of these women are the sale of small items and fattening livestock. 

Madame Souda, 30, is married and raising seven children, of whom one is a nephew whose father is deceased. She is standing on the right in this photo, dressed in light blue, with a blue headscarf, raising her left hand. 

She fattens livestock, but also sells a few groceries. She buys her sheep at the weekly markets and sells them in the same place after having fattened them for three to six months. She has a lot of experience in this field. 

With her loan, she wants to buy some new sheep to expand her flock so that she can make a lot of money when she sells them again, since she sells some at the end of her loan period so that she can reimburse the loan. 

She hopes to expand her savings with the profit she makes. She helps to cover some family expenses so that her husband can better care for their children.

loans.use: to buy sheep to fatten and sell later on.

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en:
Delphine is 30 years old and is married with four children between the ages of 10 and 11. She earns a living by sewing different styles of clothing. Her business is well organized and she has four years of experience. She works from 5 a.m. until 10 p.m. every day. Delphine employs one person to help her.

Delphine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more cloth for sewing clothes. She hopes to increase her profits so she can save for her future and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth for sewing.

loans.name: Sopp Serigne Mansour Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est créé le 12 mai 2010. Il est composé de quinze femmes partageant la même concession et qui sont parentes. Elles mènent la même activité de petit commerce.

Madame Kiné est âgée de 34 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants en charge dont un qui lui a été confié. Elle est debout à droite sur la photo et est habillée en sari rouge toute souriante.

Elle mène une activité de petit commerce d'huile d'arachide qu'elle transforme elle même et des fruits; et a une bonne expérience pour ces activités.

Elle s'approvisionne au marché hebdomadaire en arachide pour la transformation en huile et pendant les moments où le produit se fait rare elle achète des fruits selon la période et les revend au marché. 

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter de l'arachide en grande quantité pour stocker et ainsi se faire beaucoup de revenus.




Avec ses bénéfices elle souhaite renforcer son épargne et faire de l'embouche dans un futur proche. Son mari se charge des affaires de la famille pour leur bien être à tous.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on May 12,  2010. It is composed of 15 women who share a concession and are related to each other. They all have businesses selling small items.  

Madame Kiné is 34. She is married and raising four children, one of whom was confided to her by someone else. She is standing on the right in the photo and is dressed in a red sari and smiling broadly. 

Her business is making and selling peanut oil as well as selling fruit. She has a lot of experience in these activities. She buys her supplies at the weekly market. During those periods where peanuts are rare, she buys whatever fruit is in season and resells it at the market. 

Her loan will allow her to buy large quantities of peanuts to stockpile and thus earn a lot of income. With her profit, she hopes to add to her savings and, in the near future, to do fattening of goats and sheep. Her husband is responsible for the family, for the well-being of all.

loans.use: to buy peanuts in large quantities and seasonal fruit for resale.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan, age 20, owns a small chicken shop, which he has operated since 2009. He has eight years of experience in this field and is a hard worker. Hassan was too young when he started working, but he had to assist his parents in earning a living to support the family. He worked in a chicken slaughterhouse at the beginning and eventually opened his own business. 

Hassan is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy a grill and a special shawarma cooking machine. A shawarma (شاورما‎ in Arabic) is a traditional Arab sandwich-like wrap of shaved lamb, goat, chicken, turkey, or beef, or a mixture thereof. The meat is placed on a spit and may be grilled for as long as a day. Shawarma is a popular food staple across the Arab world and is enjoyed in Palestine, Europe, and the Caucasus. Shawarma is eaten with pita bread, lavash bread, tabbouleh salad, fattoush salad, taboon bread, tomato, and cucumber. Toppings include tahini, hummus, pickled turnips, and amba. Shawarma is shared by many countries and includes a number of variations. In Greece, it is called gyros, meaning "turned." In Armenian, it is tarna, literally meaning "to turn," and in Turkish it is called döner kebab, which in turn means "turning kebab." Indeed, the word shawarma (pronounced /ʃəˈvɑːrmə/) comes from the Turkish word çevirme [tʃeviɾˈme], meaning "turning."

Hassan is sure that this loan will increase his income by attracting new customers. He hopes to continue to expand his business more in the future.

loans.use: to buy a grill and a special shawarma cooking machine

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en:
Shavkat, age 36, owns and operates a café where he prepares and sells shish kebab. His café is located at the market and he has been in this business for six years. On average, he services 20 to 25 clients a day. Shavkat tries to use only the best inputs in his café. He believes that this is why the business is stable and brings in considerable income for the family. He and his wife have two children.

Shavkat is planning to expand his business, thereby to earn more money to support his household. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting 8,500 Somoni. He is planning to purchase the meat and coal required for cooking shish kebab in his café. This amount will help him accomplish his goals on an accelerated schedule. 

Shavkat thanks everyone who is supporting him. 

More about Tajikistan:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history. It was a key post along the Silk Road and served as the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous, leaving only 7 percent of arable land. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International:
 
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: to purchase the meat and coal required for cooking shish kebab in his café

loans.name: Groupe  1

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe 1 de l’association JANTOYERELA II sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à NIANTANSO, un des villages de la commune de KOLOKOBA, préfecture de Sikasso, (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution et le prêt passé a été bien  remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée par ce groupe d’homme  est le maïs avec  AROUNA.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, AROUNA compte payer les frais de labour, acheter de l’engrais et de l’herbicide. 
Les productions du groupe sont vendues au niveau du marché de Farakala  et au marché de Sikasso après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
AROUNA compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 180 000 par campagne qui sera utilisé pour  prendre en charge les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of Group 1 of the association JANTOYERELA II are married men, and they average 40 years of age and five children each living for the most part in polygamous families in NIANTANSO, a village in the Commune of KOLOKOBA, Prefecture of  Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to carry out their farm work during the off-season. And they are on their second collaborating with the institution. The last loan was properly repaid. 

The crop grown by this group of men is corn, as is the case with AROUNA, who plans to use this loan to cover the cost of plowing and to purchase manure and some pesticides.  

After a harvest, the group’s produce is sold at the Farakala market and also at the Sikasso market to a customer base composed of women and men.

AROUNA plans on making an average profit of 180,000 francs CFA per planting. The profit will be used for meeting the needs of his family.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and to buy manure and herbicides

loans.name: Santa Yalle Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 19 décembre 2001. Il est composé de 11 femmes qui habitent toutes le même quartier. Elles s'activent dans le petit commerce.

Madame GNALING debout à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 39 ans. Elle est marié et mère de six enfants. Elle a aussi en charge trois autres enfants confiés par des proches.

Elle vend des légumes. Elle a une très bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plusieurs années.

Le prêt reçu lui permettra de mieux développer son activité de vente de légumes.

les bénéfices lui permettront d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille( santé, habillement, nourriture)et de renforcer ses épargnes.
texts.en: The Santa Yalle solidarity group was created on December 19, 2001.  It is composed of 11 women who live in the same neighborhood.  They keep busy with small businesses. GNALING, standing at the right of the photo with her hand raised, is the leader of the group.  She is 39 years old.  She is married and the mother of six children.  She is also responsible for three other children entrusted to her care by relatives. She sells vegetables.  She has had a very good experience in this domain which she has practiced for several years. The loan received will enable her to better develop her vegetable-selling business. The profits will permit her to improve the living conditions of her family (health, clothing, diet) and to beef up her savings.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Ganijon

texts.en:
Ganijon owns and operates a grocery store business. Approximately 10 years ago, Ganijon rented a place that had terrible conditions and was very deteriorated, and it was there that he started his business. He improved the space and expanded his grocery, and now it is one of the most popular groceries in his community. He has proven his belief that a person can reach his goals little by little through perseverance and dedication. Thanks to his skills and strengths, and fueled by the desire to provide a better future for his family, he moved from being a simple salesman to becoming his own boss. 

Ganijon is requesting a loan of 8,000 Somoni to increase the inventory of foodstuff items in his grocery store. Ganijon is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push himself to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. It seems certain that his perseverance and clear vision will become key factors for the success of his small business.       
 
More about Tajikistan:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history. It was a key post along the Silk Road and served as the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous, leaving only 7 percent of arable land. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International:
 
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of foodstuff items in his grocery store so as to expand his range of product offerings

loans.name: Mamy Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est créé le 18 décembre 2001. Il est composé de 13 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale et le petit commerce.

Madame Mousba qui est à gauche de la photo emmitouflée d'une écharpe est le responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 65 ans. Elle est mariée sans enfants mais à la charge de cinq enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches.

Elle fait un petit commerce de sucre et de thé. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pratiquer depuis plus de cinq ans.

Ce prêt lui permettra de mieux développer ses activités et de satisfaire sa clientèle.

Les profits générés par son activité lui permettront d'aider son mari dans la prise en charge des frais de nourriture de la famille.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on December 18, 2001. It is composed of 13 women who live in the same neighborhood. Their main business is selling various small items. 

Madame Mousba who is on the left of the photo wrapped in a scarf is the leader of the group. She is 65 and married with no biological children but responsible for five children who have been confided to her by those around her. 

She sells sugar and tea. She has a good deal of experience in this field since she has been working at it for more than five years.

This loan will permit her to develop her business and satisfy her clientele. The profit from her business will allow her to help her husband take charge of food expenses for the family.

loans.use: to buy sugar and tea.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en:
Alisher provides transportation services around the territory of Istaravshan, where he lives with his wife and two young children. His business is the only source of income for his family. He has been in this business for four years. Alisher enjoys his work because he loves being around other people. 
 
Alisher is planning to use his loan of 10,000 Somoni to make essential repairs to his vehicle. He is confident that these repairs will make his car more durable and will help him handle tough competition and expand his business. Profits generated will not only promote continued growth for Alisher’s business but will also provide a better income for his family. Alisher is a balanced and determined individual who has repaid his previous loans from IMON International without any delinquencies.

More about Tajikistan:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history. It was a key post along the Silk Road and served as the location for the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous, leaving only 7 percent arable land. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

More about IMON International:
 
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for necessary repairs to his minivan

loans.name: Bountal Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est créé le 18 décembre 2001. Il est composé de 09 femmes qui habitent le même village. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce d'huitre, de l'huile de palme et de miel.

Madame Fanseyni qui est à gauche de la photo emmitouflée s'une écharpe est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants en sa charge.

Elle fait un petit commerce d'huitre. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus d'une décennie.

Ce prêt lui permettra de mieux développer son activité et de répondre à la demande de ses clients.

les bénéfices lui permettront de prendre en charge les frais de santé et de nourriture de sa famille.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on December 18, 2001. It is composed of nine women who live in the same village. Their main business is selling oysters, palm oil, and honey. 

Madame Fanseyni who is on the left in the photo, wrapped up in a scarf, is responsible for the group. She is 43, married and raising two children. 

She has a small business selling oysters. She has been in this business for more than ten years. This loan will allow her to develop her business and respond to the demand of her customers. The profit will allow her to pay healthcare expenses and buy food for her family.

loans.use: to buy oysters.

loans.name: Khudoiberdi

texts.en:
Khudoiberdi has worked in agriculture for eight years, during which time he has gained much experience and a love for the land. He began cultivating his land through his own efforts and has gradually gotten ahead in life. Khudoiberdi lives in the town of Istaravshan with his wife and three children. His wife is a vendor and helps support the family. 

Khudoiberdi would like to use this loan to buy supplies needed for the harvest and for improving production. With these, he can increase the quality of his yield along with his earnings at the time of harvest and sale.  

More about Tajikistan:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history. It was a key post along the Silk Road and served as the location for the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous, leaving only 7 percent arable land. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

More about IMON International:
 
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
Matluba is a mother with a great desire to get ahead in life. Her great spirit, strong will, and hard work have allowed her to improve her and her family's quality of life. For the past 11 years, this persevering lady has been working very hard raising and selling cattle. She uses the income she generates to provide a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy.

Matluba has requested a loan of 7000 Tajikistani somoni (TJS) to buy more young cattle that she will sell when they are fully grown. With this investment, she will be able to increase her earnings substantially and improve her quality of life.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase young cattle in order to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en:
Mahmud is 50 years old. He is married and has 4 children. Mahmud's goals are to grow in his personal life and develop his business. His wish is to offer better service to his customers. His dream is that God continues to provide him with life to get ahead and fulfill his goals.

Mahmud is a taxi driver who travels through the streets of Istaravshan, Tajikistan, in search of customers. He has owned his business for 17 years. Currently Mahmud’s car needs some repairs, so he would like to borrow 7000 Tajikistani somoni (TJS). The financing will go towards fixing his car and purchasing tires. Mahmud thanks Kiva and all the lenders who make this help possible.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair his taxi

loans.name: Jantoyerela  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe JANTOYERELA 2 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant dans des  familles polygames à NIANTANSO, un des villages de la commune de KOLOKOBA, préfecture de Sikasso, (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution et les prêts passés ont été bien  remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée par ce groupe d’homme  est le maïs à instar de ABDOULAYE (le premier débout, en chemise noire, la houe sur l'épaule).
Avec ce nouveau prêt, il compte payer les frais de labour, acheter de l’engrais et de l’herbicide. 
Les productions du groupe sont vendues au niveau du marché de Farakala et au marché de Sikasso après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
ABDOULAYE compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 120 000 par campagne qui sera utilisé pour  prendre en charge les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The seven members of the JANTOYERELA 2 group are married men with an average age of 38 and four children. They live in polygamous families in NIANTANSO, one of the villages of the commune of KOLOKOBA, Sikasso prefecture, (third administrative region of Mali). 

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed in their agricultural endeavors during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution and the prior loans were reimbursed correctly. 

The crop this group of men cultivate is maize, as does for example ABDOULAYE. With this new loan he intends to pay for plowing, fertilizer, and herbicide. 

The group's crops are sold at the market of Farakala and the market of Sikasso after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. 

ABDOULAYE expects to make an average profit of 120,000 per season which will be used to cover family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, fertilizer, and herbicides.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 29-year-old married man and a father of 3 children. He has worked in agriculture since 2001, and he started raising his own cattle, trading with their milk, and farming in 2008.

Hussein likes his business a lot and works hard to improve it. He has requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to buy a new cow, which will help increase his dairy production and support him financially.

Hussein works hard to provide his children with the best living and hopes to provide them with the best education ever. His clients like dealing with him a lot because of his high-quality products. He hopes to increase his cattle herd and improve the quantity and quality of his farming.

loans.use: to buy a cow to increase his cattle herd and dairy production

loans.name: Kotognogontala. Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA  sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à KOLOKODENI, un des villages de la commune de  KOLOKOBA, préfecture de Sikasso, (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution et le prêt passé a été bien  remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée par ce groupe d’homme  est le maïs. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, SERIBA. compte payer les frais de labour, acheter de l’engrais et de l’herbicide. 
Les productions du groupe sont vendues au niveau du marché de Farakala  et au marché de Sikasso après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
SERIBA compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 280 000 par campagne qui sera utilisé pour  prendre en charge les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members if the Kotognogontala group are married men. On average, they are 40 years old with 4 children, and most of them live in polygamous families in Kolokodeni, one of the villages in the commune of Kolokoba, Sikasso prefecture (third administrative district of Mali). They are working with micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so that they can manage their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their fifth experience with Soro Yiriwaso, and all previous debt has been completely repaid. 

The men plan to grow corn. With this new loan, Seriba expects to pay for plowing costs and buy fertilizer and weedkiller. After harvest, the group's crops are sold at the Farakala and Sikasso markets, to customers who  are both men and women. Seriba is planning to make an average profit of 280,000 with each loan. The profit will be used to pay for the family's needs.

loans.use: to pay for plowing costs, and the purchase of fertilizers and weedkillers

loans.name: Amira

texts.en:
Amira is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She owns the only grocery store in her region, which makes her well-known in her area.  So if you need anything, you only have to go straight to Amira, and you'll get what you need.

In order to start the summer season in a professionA. way, Amira has requested a loan from A. Majmoua to get speciA. summer offers on specialized summer items, such as soft drinks and ice cream. She is satisfied with her income and hopes to keep on satisfying all of her customers' needs and requests.

loans.use: To increase her shop's capital through getting special summer offers on specialized items

loans.name: Francisca Elena

texts.es:
Francisca es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma, tiene 45 años y es casada.
Francisca tiene un multiservicios donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas y carnes. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías para surtir su tienda.
Está en FINCA Perú hace muchos años, le gusta por la facilidad con que recibe los préstamos, porque se trabaja a base de confianza y le capacitan, en su bancomunal le han enseñado a invertir su dinero. Con sus ahorros construyó el segundo piso de su casa. Su sueño es poder abrir una tienda mayorista.
texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the 'Paloma' (Dove) community bank.  She is 45 years old and married.

Francisca has a general store where she sells groceries, vegetables, fruit and meat.  She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying merchandise with which to stock her store.

Francisca has been working with FINCA Peru for many years.  She likes it for the ease with which she receives her loans, because they work based on trust, and because they provide training.  Through her community bank, she has learned how to invest her money.  With her savings, she built a second level on her home.  Her dream is to be able to open a wholesale store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise with which to stock her store

loans.name: Ld-Ancilla

texts.en:
Ancilla is 49 years old and is married with two children ages 10 and 16 years old. She sells clothes for weddings. Her business is well-organized and she has four years of experience. 

Ancilla has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more clothes for weddings. With her profit, Ancilla will pay school fees for her children and save money for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for weddings.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma, tiene 37 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos. 
Sonia tiene una panadería, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de harina, levadura, azúcar para la elaboración de panes.
Sonia y sus esposo trabajan juntos en una panadería alquilada, donde elaboran todo tipo de panes y los distribuyen a sus caseros. Con sus ahorros y semillas pudieron construir su propia panadería en su casa que pronto lo inaugurarán. Su sueño es poder abrir una pastelería y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the communal bank "Paloma". She is 37 years old, married, and she has 4 children. Sonia has a bakery. The loan which she requests will be invested in the purchase of flour, yeast, and sugar to bake breads.

Sonia and her husband work together in a bakery which they rent. They bake all types of breads which they distribute to their neighbors. With their savings and their seeds of hope they managed to build their own bakery in their house and it will soon be inaugurated. Her dream is to open a pastry shop and that her children grow up to have a career.

loans.use: to purchase flour, yeast, and sugar.

loans.name: Donata

texts.es:
Donata, es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma, tiene 44 años, es madre soltera con 3 hijos.
Donata es feriante, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes.
Donata viaja a la ferias de Matará los viernes y Seccelambras los días sábados y compra animales menores y los vende en Ayacucho.
Está en FINCA Perú, hace muchos años y le gusta porque les enseñan a trabajar y se practica los valores. Con sus ahorros pudo comprar artefactos para su domicilio. Su sueño es poder abrir un atienda mayorista.
texts.en:
Donata is a member of the communal bank "Paloma". She is 44 years old and a single mother of 3 children. Donata is a merchant. The loan which she requests will be invested in the purchase of grocery products. Donata travels to the fairs in Matara on Fridays and to Seccelambras on Saturdays to purchase small livestock, which she resells in Ayacucho.

She has been with Finca Peru (Kiva Field Partner) for many years and she appreciates it because they give work-related orientation and they practice sound values. With her savings she has managed to purchase appliances for her home. Her dream is to open a wholesale market.

loans.use: to purchase general grocery products.

loans.name: Tugeme Group

texts.en:
Asia, who is in her early thirties, is married with two children who are going to school. She has two barber shops and a general store and has also been selling second-hand clothes for 6 years. She works from 8.00 a.m. to 10.00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Asia’s 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to open her second barber shop and her general store and to start selling second-hand clothes in the area. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She has requested a loan to buy modern shavers. Her dream is to own a wholesale and retail spare-parts business for cars and motorbikes.

Asia will share this loan with her group, Tugeme, which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy modern  shavers.

loans.name: Sulpicia

texts.es: Sulpicia es socia del Banco Comunal los Claveles, tiene 57 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Sulpicia se dedica a la venta de anticuchos de corazón, pancitas y también a la venta de ganados. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá  en la compra de ganados. Comenzó con éste negocio hace 33 años con ello educó a sus hijos y esposo. Le gusta FINCA Perú, por la facilidad en los créditos, en la capacitaciones les enseñan a practicar lo valores, a mejorar en su familia y negocio, a tenido difilcutades su mamá sufrió un derrame cerebral. Ahora está educando a sus sobrinos que son huérfanos y su sueño es que ellos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Sulpicia is a member of the communal bank "Los Claveles". She is 57 years old, married, and she has three children. 

Sulpicia sells heart kebabs, haggis, and she also sells livestock. 

The loan which she requests will be invested in the purchase of cattle. She started this business 33 years ago and through it she sent her children and husband to school. She appreciates Finca Peru (Kiva Field Partner) for the easy loan process and for the training they receive on practicing sound values to improve their family and their business. She has had personal difficulties following her mother's stroke. She is now keeping her orphaned nieces and nephews in school and her dream is for them to earn a career.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: C 7930 Twegerane Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 30 years old and is married with three children between 4 and 11 years old. 

Jacqueline is the leader of this group called "Twegerane," which means in English "To Be Together." In the photo, she is in the first line and she has an umbrella in her hand.  

She sells fertilizer and her business is well organized. The business hours are from 6 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day except on the weekend, and she currently employs four people to help her.

Jacqueline and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase their businesses. She will buy more fertilizer to sell. With any profits from this loan, they will reinvest in their businesses and save for their future and for paying children`s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizer to sell.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es: La señora Segundina es comerciante en el mercado de la zona desde hace dos años, se dedica a la venta de ropa de niño en mayor parte,  no cuenta con puesto fijo lo que le dificulta tener mayor venta de sus productos, vive en domicilio de propiedad de sus padres con sus nietos a quienes tiene que cuidar ya que los padres de los niños se fueron al exterior a trabajar buscando un mejor futuro, solicita el crédito para la compra de mas mercadería ropa por docena para esta temporada de invierno como chompas y chamarras, es una persona muy amable y trabajadora su deseo es mejorar sus ingresos y así crecer en su negocio, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Segundina has been selling goods in her local market for two years.  She mainly sells children's clothes.  She does not have a fixed sales location which makes it difficult for her to sell more products.  She lives in a house belonging to her parents together with her grandchildren who she has to look after because their parents went abroad to work, in search of a better future.  She is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise (clothes in bulk) for this winter season such as sweaters and jackets.

Segundina is a very kind and hard-working person and her wish is to improve her income and grow in her business.  She is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (winter clothes)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy plastic to make baskets

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 33 years old and is married with two children aged 3 and 4. She sells various vegetables such as tomatoes and aubergines in her boutique. Her business is well-organized. She has two years of experience in her business and she works from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day except Sunday.

Chantal has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more vegetables to sell, so she can improve her business. With the extra profit, Chantal will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase various vegetables such as tomatoes and aubergines to sell.

loans.name: Deisy

texts.es: Deisy, tiene la edad de 60 años, está casada, tiene un hijo y vive con  su esposo. Ella pretende con el dinero realizar la compra de insumos para la asistencia de su vivero  para el buen mantenimiento de sus flores. Ella cuanta con las instalaciones ya hechas y con plantas  como pastoras y chinas para la venta a sus clientes. Ella lo que quiere es tener sus plantas en buenas condiciones  de calidad y así poder venderlas bien bonitas a sus clientes. Ella  quiere hacer crecer su vivero y generar las ganancias para seguir adelante con el proyecto. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Deisy is 60 years old and married.  She has one child and lives with her husband.  She plans to use her loan money to buy supplies for her plant nursery, so that she can care for her flowers properly.  She already has the installations and plants such as poinsettias and 'chinas' to sell to her customers.  What she wants is to have good-quality plants so that she can sell them looking really beautiful to her customers.  She would like to grow her nursery business and make the profits necessary to get ahead in her project.

This is the first loan that Deisy has received from FUDECOSUR.  She has not received previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR have offered her this loan with better repayment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to stock her plant nursery

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Dora Wilma

texts.es: La Sra. Dora tiene como actividad la venta de ropa nueva jeans y chamarras del mismo material, ella vende en una populosa zona de el alto de la paz, su familia esta compuesta por su esposo y sus dos hijos, el esposo trabaja en el exterior del país de donde manda remesa para su familia, el destino del crédito es para poder incrementar su capital de trabajo con la compra de mercadería  al por mayor ya que se acerca la época de frio y ella desea comprar ropa de invierno ya que sus clientes ya le hacen pedidos, es una persona muy amable que sola se esta encargo de su familia por la ausencia de su esposo, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Dora's business is selling new clothes, jeans and jackets made from the same material.  She sells her products in a busy area of El Alto, La Paz.  Her family consists of her husband and her two children.  Her husband works abroad and sends money home to his family.

Dora will use her loan to increase her working capital, buying merchandise wholesale, as the cold season is approaching and she would like to buy winter clothes since her customers are already placing orders with her.  Dora is a very kind person who is solely in charge of her family, owing to her husband's absence.  She is very grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale (winter clothes)

loans.name: Edwin Enrique

texts.es:
Este cliente, el señor Edwin Enrique  tiene domicilio en esta ciudad de Managua, es persona  estudiada y trabajador  padre de familia que lleva el sustento diario a su familia con buenos   principios y valores  que sacando adelante a toda  su familia. 

El señor  Edwin  Enrique pensando en el bienestar de su familia y en darle una mejor calidad de vida acudió ante nuestras oficinas con  el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, el objetivo de este crédito lo necesita para la compra de materiales de construcción como bloques, arena, cemento, piedrín, hierro y pago de mano de obra esto será utilizado para hacer ampliación y mejoramiento de su hogar  y así  ofrecerle  un hogar digno a su familia.
texts.en:
Edwin Enrique lives in his own home in the city of Managua.  He is an educated and hard-working father who provides for his family with good principles and values.  He is getting his whole family ahead in life.

With his family's well-being in mind and a wish to provide them with a better quality of life, Edwin Enrique came to our offices to request a loan to improve the condition of his home.  He needs this loan to buy building materials such as blocks, sand, cement, gravel and iron.  He will also pay labor costs.  This is to extend and improve his house, so that he can provide his family with a decent home.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home and to buy building materials

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge Luis, tiene la edad de 52 años, está casado, el  vive con  su esposa y sus 3  hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El pretende con el crédito realizar la asistencia de su cafetal para así poder obtener mejores ganancias. El cuenta con el terreno apto para la explotación del cultivo y esta ya sembrado de café. El pretende abonarlo y asistirlo para así obtener mejores producciones  más altas y generar las ganancias para el bienestar de su familia.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis is 52 years old and married.   He lives with his wife and three children who are his main priority in life.  He plans to use this loan to care for his coffee plantation so that he can make better profits.  He has a suitable plot of land for growing crops and it is already sown with coffee.  He plans to add fertilizers and care for his crops so that he can obtain a better, higher yield and make the profits he needs to take care of his family's well-being.

This is Jorge Luis' first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He has not received previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR have provided him this loan with better repayment facilities and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to care for his coffee crop

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to his home, buying building supplies

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es: Ernestina  desde Carrizal agradece por la financiación de su negocio, pues con el credikiva ha logrado aumentar su capital  de trabajo y así mismo sus ventas e ingresos. Con su anterior crédito logró comprar en mayor volumen víveres como arroz aceite, azúcar cervezas y otros productos de la canasta familiar a los cuales puso muy buenos precios.  Con su nuevo credikiva planea comprar ropa y calzado para caballeros, a propósito de la temporada del día del padre que se acerca;  fecha  en la cual ocurre un  notable incremento sobre sus ventas  y desde ya tiene muchos encargos de familias que quieren vestir elegante a su progenitor. Si usted quiere conocer la historio de Ernestina ingrese al siguiente enlace:http://kiva.org/lend/195125
texts.en:
From Carrizal, Ernestina sends thanks for financing her business.  With her previous Kiva loan, she managed to increase her working capital and also her sales and profits.  She managed to use her previous loan to buy a larger quantity of products such as rice, oil, sugar, beer and other basic household products which she sold for very good prices.

Ernestina plans to use her new Kiva loan to buy men's clothes and footwear as Fathers Day is approaching.  Around this date, she experiences a notable increase in her sales and she has many orders from families who want to dress their fathers well.

If you would like to learn more about Ernestina's story, you can follow this link: http://kiva.org/lend/195125

loans.use: to buy men's clothes and footwear

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El Sr. José  es un cliente se encuentra en su segunda secuencia, el cliente es de muy buena actitud en Sr. José se dedica al transporte urbano,  el cliente necesita el crédito para comprar una computadora para su niña ya que ella esta en colegio y lo necesita. Este solo tiene una niña y su esposa se dedica al comercio, la señora esta en constantes viajes al interior del país, el deseo del Sr. José es el de ver a su hijita profesional y también poder ahorra dinero para comprarse otro auto, es una persona trabajadora y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
José is a client who is entering his second loan cycle.  He has a very good attitude.  José provides an urban transport service.  He needs this loan to buy a computer for his daughter as she is in high school and needs one.  He only has one daughter and his wife buys and sells products.  His wife is constantly traveling to the provinces.

José's wish is to see his young daughter become a professional.  He would also like to be able to save up enough money to buy himself another car.  He is a hard-working person and is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered him.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Henry Daniel

texts.es: Henry Daniel, tiene la edad de 27  años, está en unión libre, el  vive con  su esposa y su hijo que son sus mayores prioridades. El pretende con el crédito  realizar la compra de más pollos de engorde. El quiere llegar a establecer una granja para la crianza de pollos de engorde  y así ir saliendo con sus proyectos y expectativas. El piensa  en el futuro de su familia y quiere poderles ir dando día con día  una mejor calidad de vida y así tener un ambiente familiar mejor y en mejores condiciones.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Henry Daniel is 27 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife and his son who are his main priorities in life.  He plans to use this loan to buy more chickens to fatten.  He would like to eventually set up a chicken farm and move ahead with his projects and plans.  He is thinking of his family's future and would like to be able to keep providing them with a better quality of life, a better family environment and better conditions.

This is Henry Daniel's first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He has not received any previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR have provided him this loan with better repayment facilities and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to raise chickens

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: La Union Es Progreso Group

texts.es:
La señora Ofelia Margarita D. 56 años D. edad, es socia D. la Alcancía comunal La Unión Es Progreso, Ella es una madre soltera que tiene dos hijos el hijo mayor tiene un  trabajo independiente, el hijo menor cursa en el colegio del estado. La socia se levanta a tempranas horas D. la mañana para que pueda preparar el desayuno para sus hijos y enviarle al colegio, la socia tiene una bodega comercial quien  se dedica todo el día en la venta D. verduras, condimentos, carnes y otros. Solicito el préstamo para que pueda incrementar y surtir sus productos. 
Préstamo es D. s/. 1000.00 Nuevo Soles.
texts.en: Ofelia Margarita is 56 years old. She is a member of the La Unión es Progreso communal bank. She is a single mother and she has two children. The older son works independently and the younger son is studying at a state school. Ofelia wakes up early in order to prepare breakfast for her children and send them off for the day. She has a store where she sells vegetables, condiments, meats and other products all day. She is requesting a loan in order to increase and stock up on her products. The loan is for 1000.000 Nuevos Soles.

loans.use: to sell grocery and other products

loans.name: Lorena Lizeth

texts.es:
Esta señora reside en la capital de Managua, es persona de buenos valores responsable y  trabajadora.
