Sochan is 28 years old and her husband, Vannak, is 31 years old.  They have been married since 2003 and have one son who attends school. The family lives along National Road Number Six, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sochan is asking for a loan of $500. She will use part of the loan to purchase a new motorbike, because the old one breaks very often. She will also use a portion to pay school fees for her brother, who is training to become a barber.

Photo: Sochan and her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike and to pay school fees for her brother, who is training to become a barber.

loans.name: Bunthea

texts.en:
Bunthea (pictured here) is a truck driver. He has been married since 2007 and has a young son. His wife works in factory that produces clothes. They live in a village along National Road Number Four, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Bunthea is applying for a loan of $1,000 to purchase new wheels for his truck, because the existing ones are old.

loans.use: To replace the wheels on his truck.

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Um, age 39, lives with her husband and her six children in the Barat district of Kompong Tom. Three of her children are employed in various occupations. Um earns a daily income by selling many kinds of goods which she acquires from her neighbors and people who reside in her village. She and her husband go out together in order to buy old things, for example, old papers, old plastic goods, old bottles, electrical wires, and other second-hand items. After buying, they sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other countries for net income. From her business, Um makes a profit of about $5 per day for supporting her family and paying various expenses. 

Um would like to ask for a loan as additional capital for purchasing more used goods for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more used goods for resale.

loans.name: Sinara

texts.en:
Sinara is 27 years old, and his wife, Sokrus, is 29.  The couple, pictured above, have been married for four years and have a young son who is one-and-a-half years old. The family lives in a village along National Road 10, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sinara hopes to expand his house so it would be better for family members to live in. Hence he is asking for a loan in the amount of $800.

loans.use: To expand the house where he lives.

loans.name: Visal

texts.en:
Visal is a motor taxi driver, while his wife is a garment-factory worker. They live in a village along National Road Number One, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City, and have three children--one son and two daughters.

Visal hopes to expand and organize his house to make it easier for family members to stay. Hence he is asking for a loan of $500.

loans.use: To expand and better organize the house where he lives.

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
Adoracion is 59 years old and married with 4 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Adoracion has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feed, medicines, and vaccines for her pigs.

Adoracion has been raising pigs for 11 years.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicines, and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Marilyn

texts.en:
Ma. Marilyn is 52 years old and married with two children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Ma. Marilyn has been raising pigs for 11 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Ma. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anjilyn

texts.en:
Anjilyn is 29 years old and married with 2 children. With 1 child in school, Anjilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Anjilyn runs a rice-retailing business in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional rice to sell. She has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Anjilyn would like to repair and renovate her family's home.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice to sell

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is married with four children, two of whom are in school. She is 31 years old and a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Thelma has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Thelma has been in this business for 7 years.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is from the village of Segatic Daku, Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Jocelyn is married and has 5 school-aged children.

Jocelyn owns & operates a dress shop (gowns for wedding, parties and etc.) and sewing services to her community, where she resides now. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide sewing services. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide her sewing service. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Jocelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide sewing service.

loans.name: Ket

texts.en:
Mrs. Ket has a small kiosk wooden house, from which she is used to selling a few fresh fruits and vegetables in the Baray district. She has been running this selling business for over eight years, earning a profit an average of US$5 to cover the daily expenses in her family. She also has a life partner in her husband who is a blacksmith. He is making around $9 each day to share the financial responsibility with Mrs. Ket. 

This couple has been married for many years and is blessed with a school-aged child. Mrs. Ket’s husband wants to have his own place for starting the blacksmith business but he doesn’t have cash to make it possible. Seeing that, Mrs. Ket has been seeking a Kiva loan to build a new smithy for her husband. Mrs. Ket hopes she will increase her income to make her family to live a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to build a new smithy for her husband.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is a single woman, of 70 years old. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Candelaria has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.
Candelaria has been in this business for 50 years.  In the future, Candelaria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en:
Bolormaa is 39 years old and lives with her husband and four children in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband manages a tire repair business and her older daughter is a hairdresser. Her two children, aged 11 and 14, are disabled and her younger one is in secondary school. 

Bolormaa manages a felt craft making business in her town. She started her business after her graduation from a felt craft making course, in 2009. Now her working capital exceeds 250,000 MNT, with daily earning of 5000-9000 MNT. She is a polite and friendly woman who says, "I want to have a nice house where my disabled children can live safely." She is requesting a 500,000 MNT to purchase home appliances for her disabled children.

loans.use: to purchase home appliances.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 47 years old and married. She has 5 children. She earns a living by leasing farm equipment in the Philippines. Eva is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional farm equipment to lease.

Eva has been leasing farm equipment for 10 years and also earns additional income from rice retailing and pig fattening. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional farm equipment to lease.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 40 years old. She is married and has 6 children.  

Evangeline earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. Evangeline has been raising pigs for 17 years and also earns additional income from rice retailing. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to build and expand her business, to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business in the Philippines selling used clothes.

Flavia has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell. She has been in this business for 30 years now. In the future, Flavia would like to save enough to provide a secure future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sainbayar

texts.en:
Sainbayar is 23 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Uvs province of Mongolia. His son is 2 years old and goes to a kindergarten. 

Sainbayar manages a shoe making business, with the help of his wife in his town. They started their business at a rented workshop in 2008. His wife is responsible for making Mongolian traditional shoes and he is responsible for selling and repairing them. Now their business has been stabilized and they are planning to expand their business. He attributes their business success to the workshop's good location. Sainbayar has great enthusiasm and energy to continue their business in the future. He is a hardworking man who is going to renew his workshop soon. He says, "I want to have my own workshop someday." He is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan to purchase materials in order to make more shoes.

loans.use: to purchase materials.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is married and has 6 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gina is 53 years old.

Gina has a selling of used clothes business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more bundles of used clothes to sell. Gina has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Vang

texts.en:
From Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap Province, Vang is a 58 year old woman who earns a profit by breeding a few pigs in a cage behind her house. 

For additional profit, Vang also distills liquor at her house and is earning an income of around $1.50 a day. Her husband is domestic farmer, and he often plants some crops on his own land. They have three single children, one of whom works in the same business. As this is rainy season, Vang’s husband doesn’t have funds to start growing his crops yet. Therefore, Vang would like a loan to buy a plowing machine to plow; her husband can begin to plant his crops.

loans.use: to buy a plowing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials for making shoes

loans.name: Armando

texts.en: Armando is married with 3 school-aged children.  He is a farmer working in the Philippines and has been doing this work for 15 years.  Armando is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure and seeds of rice to be planted in his farm.  Armando hopes this loan will grow his operations.  Currently, he earns PHP 60,000 each crop season.  Armando desires to expand his farm site sooner as an additional source of income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds of rice

loans.name: Nyamjav

texts.en: Nyamjav is 27 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Uvs province of Mongolia.  His wife is a student.  He manages a transportation service business between Ulaanbaatar city and the border with China.  He started his business in 2009 and is planning to continue it in the future.  He is a polite man who is planning to have an apartment for his family.  He is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase auto parts for his truck.

loans.use: To purchase auto parts

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is 45 years old and widowed with 4 children.  With 1 child in school, Judy works very hard to provide for them.

Judy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stocks to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc in her general store.

Judy has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as curls, bread, sardines, etc.. 

In the future Judy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jargal

texts.en:
Jargal is 24 years old and lives with her husband in an apartment in Hovd province of Mongolia.  Her husband is an officer at a government agency.  She manages a hair salon in her town. She started her business in 2010 and is planning to expand her business in the future. 

She used to work as hairdresser at Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia for several years.  During that time she gained enough knowledge and experience to open her own hair salon.  She is a polite woman who is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to purchase equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for her hair salon

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is single. She is 56 years old and lives in Canubungan Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She sells products like Milo, noodles, coffee, fruit such as bananas and other items to earn a living. She has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns about $210 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional goods to sell. Nida has been a member of GDMPC for seven years.  In the future, she hopes to increase her savings for future needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella works hard to support her family. She is married and has an electronics repair business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years.

She requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her shop. In the future, Bella would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her electronics repair shop.

loans.name: Davaanyam

texts.en: Davaanyam is 26 years old and lives with his parents and younger brother in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province of Mongolia. He manages an auto parts repair business with the help of his younger brother. In 2009 he built his own workshop near to his home and began his service business. Since then he has gained much experience and is planning to conduct a tire repair business too. He is a polite man who is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase auto parts for his business.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.en: Marcelino is married with two adult-aged children. He is a farmer working in the Philippines and has been doing this work for twenty-four years. Marcelino is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizers like manure, pesticides and rice seed to be planted on his farm. He hopes this loan will be helpful in his operations. Currently, he earns approximately $594 each cropping. Marcelino hopes to get high yields from his farm and to save some of his income for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to obtain fertilizers, seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
The photo shows Heng in front of her house in the Ornlong Veng district, where she sells various items. She is 38 and married, and has been blessed with three children, all of whom are single. Her husband is a car taxi driver. Heng is a busy woman who works hard every day at her business operations in order to earn money to help support her family. 

Presently, her husband's business is bothered as his car is often broken, and he normally pays for mending costs. To decrease this expense, she will use this loan to add to her savings to buy a used car to replace the broken one so her husband can continue his taxi service as before.

loans.use: to buy a used car to replace the old one.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros is 32 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for the family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store. She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as juice, coffee and cereals.  In the future Milagros would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en:
Dolgorsuren is 48 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province in Mongolia. Her older son is an attorney and her second son is a student. Her younger daughter, Ariunzaya, attends the local secondary school. 

Dolgorsuren manages a vegetable trading business in her town, with the help of her husband. They started their business in 2003 and are planning to continue it in the future. She is responsible for selling the harvested vegetables, and her husband is responsible for planting them. Now they own one hectare of land where they plant carrots, cabbage and potatoes. They are one of the experienced planters in their town. 

Dolgorsuren is a polite woman who is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase seeds for her business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a school supplies and medicines sales business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eighteen years.

Carmelita requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more school supplies and medicines to sell. In the future, she would like to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies and medicines to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 49 years old and two of her children are in school. She has a fish selling business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for fifteen years.

 Florentina requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Tann

texts.en:
Tann is a businesswoman who sells a few wares in front of her home in Siem Reap Province. She sells items like soft drinks, sweets for kids and some cooking supplies. To meet the family’s living expenses, her husband works as a fisherman in and around the Tunle Sap River. 

This couple has five single children, four of whom are in school. One of their kids is employed as a masseuse and is making a profit of approximately $2 each day. 

Recently, part of Tann’s inventory was exhausted, so she wants to resupply and is requesting a loan to buy more inventory to continue selling.

loans.use: to buy more inventory to continue selling.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 49 years of age and married. He has four adult children. He earns about PHP 40,000 per crop as a farmer working in the Philippines. 

He grows a large crop of rice and has been doing it for over 20 years. George is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase pesticides, fertilizers and seeds of rice for his farm. 

He dreams that someday his business will be profitable to uplift their living condition. He also wishes to expand his area of farming for an additional source of income.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides, fertilizers and rice seeds for his farm.

loans.name: Joyline

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Joyline works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from meat vending. Joyline has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF.

Joyline is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 52 years old and married. Gloria works very hard. She runs a general story in the Philippines and has been in this business for 22 years. She sells a variety of snack and grocery items. 

Gloria has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

In the future Gloria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma, 46, is married and has seven children. Three are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Gemma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. 

Gemma requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her stall.

 In the future, Gemma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Moeurn

texts.en:
Moeurn is a 41-year-old fish vendor and widowed woman. Currently, she lives in the province of Siem Reap with eight single children. Three of her children have been working in different jobs to make an income. They always share their money with Moeurn to help with various expenses. 

Every day in early morning, Moeurn goes to buy fish from the fishermen and she hurries up and brings her fish by motorbike to the market for resale. She has a lot of regular customers who buy and eat her fish. 

She hopes to be able to find extra income by using a Kiva loan to purchase a large quantity of fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of fish to sell.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 43 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Analiza has been raising pigs for 20 years and also earns additional income from manicure/pedicure and weaving. 

Analiza is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional pigs and feed.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and feed.

loans.name: Ninda

texts.en:
Ninda is 62 years old and married with six children. Ninda works very hard to provide for them.

Ninda runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, soft drinks and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

In the future Ninda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille is married and has three children. She is 58 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, she sells a "kangkong," a Filipino vegetable used to feed pigs. She has had this business for a year. Each month, She earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional kangkong for sale. Lucille has been a member of GDMPC for this year only. This is her first loan. In the future, She hope to increase her savings.

loans.use: To purchase additional "KANGKONG" for sale

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Loida has been in this business for five years. She works hard to support her family.

Loida requested a PHP 14,500 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of fish to sell in her food stall.

In the future, Loida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Yoem

texts.en:
Yoem is a motor driver in and around Siem Reap Province. He has over five years experience in this occupation, and he can generate an income on average of US $4 per day to use for the expenses of his family. Yoem also has another financial earner. His wife sells merchandise in her community. They are blessed with six children. Most of them are students in the local school. 

Yoem now has a problem with their living conditions and he wishes to dig new posts for his house, but he lacks money. That is why Yoem would like to apply for a loan of $1,000 from Kiva through HKL.

loans.use: to dig new posts for his house.

loans.name: Liwliwa

texts.en: Liwliwa is 35 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. She earns about 60,000 PHP per crop as a farmer working in the Philippines. She grows rice and has been doing so for 10 years. Liwliwa is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farm. She dreams that someday her business will be profitable to support her children's education.

loans.use: to acquire farm inputs such as fertilizers and rice seeds

loans.name: Yana

texts.en:
Yana is married with two sons and lives in Novomoskovsk. She sells women’s clothing in the central marketplace and has been in this trade for more than 10 years. She offers a variety of merchandise for sale in her kiosk. Presently, she has 20,000 Grivnyas invested in her stock.

Yana is very consistent and focused. She has maintained a perfect credit history with “Nadiya Ukraine”. The financial wisdom she has demonstrated is one of many reasons why her business has been successful and we believe it will continue to be in the future.

Yana is seeking a 20,000 Grivnyas loan to give her some additional working capital to purchase seasonal inventory and grow her sales.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal inventory.

loans.name: Bin

texts.en: Bin has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops to earn a living and typically generates an income of $2 per day. Her husband earns a living driving a motor-trailer taxi in the busy market, Prey Chor district. This couple has been married for years and has three children, all of whom are teenagers attending school. Bin will be using her loan for rebuilding her house. Bin and her husband were taken in this photo in front of their house.

loans.use: to rebuild her house.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila, who is married with one child, sells men's clothing at the central market in Melitopol city. Ludmila has been in this business for 14 years, and during that time has developed her business well. She currently has three business locations and many repeat clients, and her goal is to open a small store to sell clothing. 

Ludmila would like to borrow 20,000 UAH to purchase seasonal inventory, hoping to thereby increase sales and move closer to achieving her business goal.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal inventory: T-shirts, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Nhim

texts.en:
Nhim is a rice farmer who lives in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham. In addition, Nhim also weaves bamboo baskets for sale. She sells her finished products to buyers who come directly to her house. She makes over 50 sets of baskets before selling them. She also orders baskets from other villagers and sells them to make additional income. 

Her husband has been earning a living for many years by climbing and tapping the palm trees behind his house. She depends on using her Kiva loan as an advance in order to buy a few sacks of fertilizer, pay for plowing costs, and hire some domestic laborers to transplant seedlings.

loans.use: to buy a few sacks of fertilizer, pay for plowing costs, and hire some domestic laborers to transplant seedlings.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married. He and his wife have one son named Nikita, who is 5 years old. Sergei sells women's clothing. His monthly profit is about 5,000 UAH.

Sergei has been in this business for 10 years. He sells clothing at different markets in the Kherson area. Instead of waiting for clients from the area to come to him, he goes out to small markets and provides clothing for many people there. Sergei is a very entrepreneurial and hard-working person. He wants to develop this business even further. His business is the only source of income for his family.

Sergei would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to purchase assorted inventory. He hopes that more variety will increase his sales and help him take better care of his family.

loans.use: to purchase assorted inventory.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Sophea is 44 years old, married, and has five children. One child is married and lives outside the family home, two are security guards, and two attend school. They live along National Road Number Two, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Their income is from her husband’s business and her children’s salaries. Sophea stays at home and does housework. Sophea’s husband is a mason; he hopes to supplement his income by driving a tuk tuk (motorcycle-based) taxi.  She is requesting for a loan of $500 to purchase a tuk tuk for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a tuk tuk for her husband.

loans.name: Sinuon

texts.en:
Sinuon (pictured here) is 38 years old, has just been married with her second husband for six months. She has one son and two daughters. Two of the children are garment factory workers and another one is in school. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh.

Sinuon is a garment factory worker, while her husband is a soldier. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to buy a motorbike for her children to drive to work.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to drive to work

loans.name: Chhoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Chhoeurn resides in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham. She is a rice cultivator and also makes mortar of hard stone to sell. Her husband works with her in making mortar to sell as well. From this, they are able to earn about 3 USD a day. The coming rainfall is good for growing rice crops. However, Mrs. Chhoeurn doesn’t have capital yet to use on her farm. Thus, Mrs. Chhoeurn is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers and other family supplies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other family supplies

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina sells women’s clothing outfits from a rented space in the local mall. Marina is married with two children. Her family is an average Ukrainian family living in the town of Novaya Kahovka. She launched her business 18 years ago in the volatile perestroika times to be able to provide for her family’s basic needs. Currently, Marina has 70,000 UAH in inventory. Monthly net profit amounts to 7,000 UAH. 

Marina is requesting a loan of 17,500 UAH to purchase assorted of merchandise for sale at her mall outlet. She believes that the loan will help her meet her customers’ demands and increase selection of merchandise for the fall season. Marina realizes that at all stages in her business development, it is important for her to offer a wide variety of items in order to keep a good reputation and attract more customers. This loan will enable her to continue building a solid foundation for her business so that it will be successful for many years to come.

loans.use: to purchase assorted of merchandise

loans.name: Sokhen

texts.en:
Sokhen (in the photo) and her husband, Ven, live in a village across the Mekong River about 17 km from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1985 and have 4 children; 2 sons and 2 daughters. One child is married and lives in separate home, one is a chef, another one has full-time employment and another one is in school. 

Sokhen sells silk fabrics. She buys them from the weavers in her village and sells them in other provinces far way from her house. Her husband is a farmer. She hopes to continue her business, so she is requesting another loan in the amount of 1,000 USD to purchase finished silk fabrics for sale.

loans.use: to purchase finished silk fabrics for sale

loans.name: Baljidmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Baljidmaa is 36 years old, lives with her husband and 3 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her eldest 2 children attend a local secondary school and the youngest one stays at home. 

Baljidmaa runs a secondhand clothes-selling business during the summer season and a timber and charcoal business during the wintertime. Her husband works for public service, but during his free time he helps in his wife’s business. Baljidmaa has been running this business since 2009 and now she is planning to focus solely on her secondhand clothing business. The used clothes come from abroad from developed countries. 

She is planning to do some renovation to her work place, which she is renting. She also wants to increase her inventory by buying more clothes. The loan she is taking will be used to buy more secondhand clothes to sell and to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more secondhand clothes for resale

loans.name: Huon

texts.en:
Huon and his wife are weavers. In addition, he does construction work and is also hired by other villagers to farm. He gets paid with wages. 

Previously, Huon asked for a Kiva loan to buy weaving materials for his weaving business. Unfortunately, the price of finished fabric dropped and the middleman paid lower prices for the silk product Huon and his wife would make. Huon was forced to quit the weaving business.

Now, Huon has started his weaving business again because it a traditional profession in the area. He is asking for a loan in the amount of 200 USD to purchase weaving materials for his and his wife’s weaving business.

Photo: Huon is weaving.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials for his and his wife’s weaving business

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea, 33, is a local farmer in the Prey Chor district. She always plants rice on her existing farmland following the rainy season and the dry season. Besides this, Chea is good at making bamboo baskets for the market. Her husband works in the construction filed as a casual construction worker. In the past, Chea used to hire the neighbor’s cow to plow the farmland. Right now, she hopes to buy her own cow and that is why she is applying for a loan from Kiva. Chea has three-age-school children.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Sâr

texts.en: From Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province, Sâr is 30 years old and married. She was married years ago and she has two single children who still study in the public school. She and her husband are currently recycling sellers. They buy used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the items in bulk to other countries. The used goods they deal in are mostly leftover electrical wires and plastic. Sâr would like to request a loan to pay for construction costs.

loans.use: to pay for construction costs.

loans.name: Channoch

texts.en:
Channoch (pictured here) is 29 years old and has just been married to her second husband for three months. She has one young son. She lives in a village on National Road number two, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  

Channoch is a garment factory worker and assists her husband when she is free. Her husband is a rice farmer. She is asking for her first loan of $600 to purchase a pipe and water pump for her husband to spray his rice farm.

loans.use: To purchase a pipe and water pump

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Chanthou is 42 years old and his wife, Sokgern is 41 years old; have been married since 1990 and have one son who is in university. They live in a village along National Road Number One about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chanthou is a driver; he drives for the office of public work and transport. His wife is a chef; she cooks for a restaurant in Phnom Penh. Chanthou is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for his son to drive to school. 

Chantou and his wife are in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his son to drive to school.

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Vannak, 37, is a gardener. Her husband, Sok, 44, is a motor taxi driver. They have been married since 1996 and have four children--three sons and one daughter. All of them are in school. They live in a village across the Mekong River, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City

Vannak is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,200 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband because the old requires frequent costly repairs. 

Photo: Vannak and her husband.

loans.use: To purchase new motorbike for her husband.

loans.name: Lyka

texts.en:
Lyka, 28, sells fish and vegetables. Her husband, Srin (pictured with her here), 28, is a construction worker. They have been married since 2004 and have two young daughters. The family lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Lyka lives with her widowed mother, sisters and brothers in the same house. She wants to live in a separate home, so she is asking for her first loan of $700 to add to her own money to build her own house to live in.

loans.use: To add to her own money to build a house to live in.

loans.name: Chhunny

texts.en:
Chhunny (pictured with her loom) is 26 years old. Her husband, Sam, is 29 years old. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2006 and have two young sons.  

Chhunny is a weaver, while her husband is a construction worker and assists his wife with weaving when he is free. Chhunny is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Thim

texts.en:
Mrs. Thim is a 41-year-old village woman who has had a job as a rice farmer since she was single. In addition, she currently buys corn from other villagers at a low price and then she takes it to boil for sale. She runs her business next to her house and is earning approximately of $1.25 a day. Her husband is a local farmer and a well digger. The humble couple has six children; one is working at a garment factory. 

This approaching rainy season, Mrs. Thim is applying for a loan to purchase a cow to plow her land so she can start to plant a rice crop.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to plow her land.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en: Miguela is 63 years old and lives in Brgy. 3, Tabgub City in the Philippines. She is married. To earn a living, Miguela has a business selling "puso," rice stuffed in a heart-shaped coconut leaf and cooked. She earns about Php 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of Php 9,000 to use to purchase rice and coconut leaves. She has been a member of GDMPC for 2 years.  In the future, Miguela would like to increase her savings.

loans.use: to purchase rice and coconut leaves.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is married with two children. She is 33 years old and lives in Migcanaway, Tangub City. Anita sells "banana cue" to earn a living and has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of Php 7000 and the purpose of this loan is to purchase bananas, barbecue sticks and charcoal. She has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to increase her savings for the future needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, barbecue sticks and charcoal.

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia is 34 years old and has given birth to three children. Her eldest son is studying in class one while the others have not started their education yet. 
Her husband has a molding business. He has a molding machine which he uses to make different items. He is very experienced in his work and provides quality services to his clients. 

Asia herself is a seamstress. She does sewing work for her neighboring clients to share the financial burden with her husband. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month. She is also a very good housewife and does her household responsibilities very well. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to buy a new molding machine. This will help him do his business better and provide better quality services to his customers. He has been operating this business for the past eight years and Asia is very confident that an investment will help him make his business more profitable and increase his income. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Asia.

loans.use: To buy a new molding machine for her husband's business.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old, single and lives with four family members, two of whom work.

Mohamad is a blacksmith; in 2010 he opened his own workshop, making doors and windows. He has a long experience and has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in his area.

 He is requesting a $2000 loan to buy a diesel generator. He is aiming to earn more profit so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a diesel generator.

loans.name: Aster's Group

texts.en:
Aster is 43 years old and has given birth to a son and three daughters. Her husband works in a private organization on monthly wage. 

Aster is very supportive and knows that alone her husband is unable to meet the financial requirements of her family; that’s why she sells clothes in order to support him. She purchases clothes from different cloth markets of the city and sells to her local area clients at a profits. She is also a very good housewife and does her household responsibilities very well.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her clothes-selling business. With the loan, she will buy clothes in bulk to fulfill the needs of her clients.  She has been operating her clothes-selling business for the past two years. She hopes that after the loan investment she will be able to improve her business. 

She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application with Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Aster.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en:
Mrs. Gantumur is 50 years old and lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She works at a meat factory in the packaging department. Her husband works for a house decoration company as a plasterer. They have an only daughter who is married and runs a grocery shop. 

Mrs. Gantumur helps in her daughter’s business by working in her grocery shop as a part-time salesperson thus earning some extra money. She is applying for a loan to increase her daughter’s working capital by buying more inventory and stock to sell.

loans.use: To increase her daughter’s working capital by buying more inventory and stock to sell.

loans.name: Bou

texts.en:
From Prey Chor district, Mrs. Bou is a 38-year-old farmer and the mother of a school-aged child. Mrs. Bou is a single mother because she got divorced from her husband when she was young and now she lives with sister (she and her sister appear in the photo). Besides her farming business, Mrs. Bou also raises a lot of piglets and she had hoped to sell them to buyers four months after she began raising them. 

Unfortunately, the pigs are not big enough, due to lack of food. To help solve this problem, Mrs. Bou has requested a loan that she will use to buy many sacks of pig feed to fatten her pigs. She will use rest of the loan towards purchasing farm supplies to use on her field.

loans.use: to buy many sacks of pig feed to fatten her pigs and also purchase farm supplies to use on her field.

loans.name: Eustaquia

texts.en:
Eustaquia, who is 60 years old and lives in Poblacion, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur in the Philippines, is married and the mother of 10 children. To earn a living, Eustaquia has a business selling a variety of foods including cooked peanut or "piniato," "tinagaktak," a food made of cassava, eggs, candies and other goods. She earns about PHP 6000 each month.

A member of GDMPC for four years, Eustaquia is now requesting a loan of Php 10000 to purchase additional goods to sell. In the future, she would like to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, a 34-year-old single mother of one child, has been running her grocery business for the past six years. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a Kadet staff member, and this will be her second loan with which she plans to buy more stocks of assorted vegetables to sell. The  anticipated profit will allow her to buy even more vegetables.

A very hardworking woman, Rose hopes to own a wholesale grocery in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of assorted vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani is a widow and mother of five children.  Rani started working after the death of her husband to fulfill the needs of her family. She is an expert in furniture polishing and took over her husband’s business after his sudden death. 

Her elder son had to leave his education and started working with his mother. Her 2nd son also works and is an employee in a private organization. Rani’s daughters are very young. Two of them study while youngest one is only three years old.  

Rani has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s business. With the loan, he will buy a furniture polisher and brushes to provide better quality services to his customers and increase his profit. He has a good experience in his work and Rani is hopeful that an investment will bring better profits to him.  

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Rani.

loans.use: To buy furniture polisher and brushes for furniture polishing business.

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en:
Mr.Batbayar, who is 27 years old, lives in a rented apartment with his wife, son and his wife’s grandmother in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city. He has worked at one of Ulaanbaatar's power plants as a mechanic since 2004.

Batbayar recently bought a plot of land and a small house using his savings and a loan from the bank. Because the house is quite old and needs some restoration, the loan he is requesting will be used to buy necessary building materials such as cement, sand, wood planks, plaster and paints to restore the house.

loans.use: to buy necessary building materials such as cement, sand, wood planks, plaster and paints to restore his recently-bought house.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan, who works hard to support her family, is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. In this business for five years, Susan has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of goods to sell in her store. In the future, she would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Perlinda

texts.en: Perlinda. a 43-year-old married mother of one child who is in school, has been farming rice in the Philippines for the past six years. She is now requesting her eighth loan for PHP 15,000  through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. In the future, Perlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Cristelita

texts.en:
Cristelita is 50 years old, married, and has five children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines, which she has done for 25 years. She also earns an income from farming sugarcane and raising pigs. She is requesting a loan for15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her store and fertilizers for her sugarcane.

Cristelita has borrowed and repaid seven previous loans from NWTF.  She aspires to repair and renovate her family home and buy more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store and fertilizers for her sugarcane.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Salvacion works hard to support her family. She has a food stall (pork barbecue and eatery) business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Salvacion is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase different ingredients for her food stall.

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase different ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Corazon

texts.en:
Ma. Corazon is 45 years old and married with four children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Ma. Corazon has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 11 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Ma. Corazon aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 24 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Janice has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for  one year and also earns an income from fish vending.

Janice aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 60 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, milk, other groceries, etc. 

Rosalia has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 34 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Rosalia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly is 45 years old and a married woman who lives in the province of Kompong Cham. She and her husband are local cultivators, and they have two children. One of their children is employed as a sewing worker.  They currently generate an income of approximately $3 per day by growing different crops. 

Mrs. Ly is seeking a loan in the amount of $600 to be used to plant a potato crop during the coming rainy season. For the future, she hopes to enlarge the size of their crops, to build a new house which is bigger than their present one, and also to help find a definite occupation for her kids.

loans.use: to plant a potato crop.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 61 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Gloria has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables.

Gloria aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 25 years old and she is married to Onesmus. She operates a school and has been in the business for one and half years, bringing in a profit of KES. 20,000 per month.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and this will be her first loan. She wants to start cooking food at the school so that the children do not have to carry food that will get cold before lunch time. She plans to use the anticipated profit to build more classes up to class eight.

In the future she hopes to have a complete school. She is a very hard-working lady.

loans.use: to start cooking food at the school.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 65 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Angelina has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari (variety) store for 10 years and also earns an income from videoke rentals.

Angelina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Abdel Wahhab

texts.en:
This borrower is a 50-year-old married man from Iraq. He lives with his wife and six children.

Abdel Wahhab has had an advertising agency since 1995 where he makes light boxes. He has a long experience and a deep understanding of local consumer needs and he has a good reputation in his area.

He is requesting a $2800 loan to make a sliding door and ceiling for his agency. He is aiming to increase his capital and to expand his business so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to make a sliding door and ceiling for his agency.

loans.name: Meredith

texts.en:
Meredith is 42 years old and has three children.  She is married and has one child who is in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Meredith requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Meredith has been raising pigs for 13 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Meredith would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 53 years old and has nine children. She is married and has one child who is still in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Thelma requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Thelma has been raising pigs for seven years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Thelma would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 51 years old and widowed with one child currently going to school, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for him. She runs a sari sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, groceries, etc.

Jocelyn has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, noodles, milk, etc.

In the future Jocelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Ma. Rochel

texts.en:
Ma. Rochel is 32 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries,etc.

Ma. Rochel has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 5 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport and rice retailing.

Ma. Rochel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 44 years old and married with one child who is currently going to school. She works very hard to provide for him. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like milk, groceries, etc.

Victoria has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as spices, soft drinks, canned goods, etc. 

In the future Victoria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase items to sell.

loans.name: Zita

texts.en:
Zita is 53, married, and has six children. 

She earns a living by raising pigs. Zita is borrowing 27,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. 

Zita has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from a sari sari store. (A sari sari store is a small general store, frequently operated from an entrepreneur's home. 

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Evelyn works hard to support her family. 

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a vulcanizing shop and food processing. Evelyn is borrowing 17,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase spare parts for maintenance of her motorcycle transport business. 

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for maintinance

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice farming business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and farming equipment for her rice farming business. 

Leonila has been in this business for five years. Leonila earns additional income from rice retailing. 

Leonila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to buy additional farmland in the future.

loans.use: To purchase of fertilizers, pesticides and farming equipment.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is 37 years old and married to Peter. They have two children. She has been selling porridge for the last nine years, earning a profit of KES. 20,000 per month. 
  
She was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADETt staff. This will be her first loan. She plans to buy more thermos bottles for supplying porridge and to employ a staff to help her. With the anticipated profits, she would like to open a hotel.

In the future, she would like to open a big hotel where she will cook and sell food. She is hardworking.

loans.use: to buy more thermos bottles and employ a staff member

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a common-law partner and parent of two children, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a buying & selling of fish & dried fish business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying & selling pigs.  Susan is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of fish to sell and to make dried fish for her buying & selling of fish & dried fish business.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fish to dry and sell

loans.name: Analeah

texts.en:
Analeah is 33 years old and married with six children. Analeah works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling young coconuts in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 1,2000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of young coconuts to sell.

Analeah has borrowed and paid back 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business for 10 years and she earns additional income from farming vegetables.

Analeah aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more young coconuts to sell

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Angeles works hard to support her family.

She has a candy making (pastilas) business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from electronic reloading. Angeles is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her candy making(pastilas) business.

Angeles has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her candy business

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable and spice business in the Philippines.  She is requesting PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of vegetables.   Belen has been in this business for 7 years.  She earns additional income from a motorcycle transport business.

Belen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and spices

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 30 years old and married, with 3 children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Celia is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other veterinary products for her pigs.

Celia has been raising pigs for 3 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling copras (dried coconut fruits).  She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other veterinary products for her pigs

loans.name: Khoy

texts.en:
Selling second-hand goods is the core activity of Mrs. Khoy. She is currently a widowed mother of three children.  One is married and lives in a separate home.   Another one helps her in her business, and the remaining one is a garment factory worker and has a specific salary every month. 

Mrs. Khov always uses her old bicycle to transport her used goods. She has concerns that when it is late she cannot go anywhere far away from her house or her village.  Because of this, Mrs. Khoy is asking for a loan from Kiva to purchase a second motorcycle and to buy more used goods for resale.

loans.use: to purchase a second motorcycle, as well as to buy more used goods for resale.

loans.name: Zack

texts.en:
Zack is 22 years old.   He is single and has been running his new clothes business for two years,

He was introduced to KADET LTD by Kadet staff, and this is first loan.  He plans to buy shirts, vests and trousers to sell at Kenyatta Market.  From the anticipated profits, he plans to add more stock.

In the future, he hopes to open a shop.  He is a very hardworking young man.

loans.use: to buy shirts, vests and trousers to sell at Kenyatta Market.

loans.name: Tabudirira Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 48-year-old Alice (with the lovely white hat) from Mutare. She is married to a council policeman, and together they have five children. She also cares for three dependents.

Alice sells clothing and electrical goods. She has been in business for two years. The main challenge she faces is the lack of working capital.

Alice has requested a loan of $400 to buy more clothing and electrical goods. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her family to develop in a multitude of ways. In the future Alice plans to open a shop.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and electrical goods.

loans.name: Mairamkul's Group

texts.en:
Mairamkul, 43, is the leader of this group. She was married 23 years ago and brought up a big family of five children. She resides in the village of Tup, which is hidden in the picturesque scenery of the Kyrgyz mountains. Families that live in this remote area follow the basic Kyrgyz nomadic lifestyle. Livestock is a big asset for the local farmers.

Mairamkul was gifted by her parents with a horse, which has been very helpful to her husband in the fields, and a cow to start a dairy business. Ten years of intensive work has led to 3,000 KGS monthly, and it has allowed Mairamkul to start construction on a house and shed for livestock.

Mairamkul hopes her group will be granted a loan, with her portion to be spent on purchasing five lambs for breeding. She looks forward to spending her profits on her house and a warehouse to store crops. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase five lambs for breeding.

loans.name: Koeut

texts.en:
There are many Cambodians who make their living as rice farmers, and one of them is Koeut, 43 and married, who has been working at this since 1990 in the Baray district of Kompong Cham province. This humble couple has four children; three are students and one is married. Two of them are working at a factory and have regular salaries each month.

Koeut and her husband grow rice on the farmland that they inherited from their grandparents. From their rice farm they can generate an income of around $3 per day. In order to increase their income, Koeut has applied for a $600 loan to buy a motorbike for her husband so he can run a motor taxi service.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband.

loans.name: Irina's Group

texts.en:
Irina, 40, is the leader of this group. A few years ago she became a widow, but it didn’t keep her from becoming an ideal parent and a role model for her three daughters and a son. Two of her kids still depend on Irina financially and that motivates her to provide a steady income. 

For four years Irina has been breeding cattle. A loan received in 2007 helped her to get involved in this small business. Along with cattle breeding Irina is involved in a home supplies retail outlet in a local market. Thanks to both businesses, Irina receives a profit of 4,000 soms per month. Now the herd has been expanded to three head. Irina plans to continue breeding cattle, therefore she asks Kiva lenders to finance the purchase of one head of cattle. Irina’s big wish and a long-term goal is to build a house of her own. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Masimba Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 42-year-old Netsai (in the middle) from Mutare. She is married with five children, one attending school. She also cares for one dependent. 

Netsai runs a retail business selling clothes, blankets, stoves, TVs and other electrical appliances. The business has been in operation for five years. She says the main challenge faced is lack of working capital. 

Netsai has requested a loan of $400 to buy electrical appliances and clothing for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's diet and pay her child’s school fees. In the future Netsai plans to have a business that is always well stocked.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances and clothing for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 31 years old, married, and a father of two, aged three and five.  He runs a tailoring business to earn a living.  He started the business nine years ago.  So far, he has employed three people.  He has benefited from Faulu Kenya because he has been able to add business stock.  He hopes to grow his business further in the future.  His dream is to become financially stable in the future.  He needs 30,000 Kes to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira, 45, is the leader of this group. Growing up in the village of Tup, she defined her future profession early in childhood. Gulmira received a degree in engineering and works as an engine-driver assistant in a cement plant. 

Gulmira has four children. Nothing went wrong until the day when she lost her husband. Then, as the only breadwinner, she had to find ways of supporting the family financially. Three years ago she and her oldest son spent their small savings on the purchase of a very first calf. Since then cattle-breeding and reselling brings in at least 2,000 soms a month to the family budget. 

Gulmira, as well as other members of her group, needs financial assistance for a further broadening of the business. Therefore they rely on Kiva lenders. Gulmira plans to spend her own part on the purchase of one more calf for fattening and resale. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf.

loans.name: Jiydekan's Group

texts.en:
Jiydekan, 52, is the leader of this group. She is a widow and resides in a town of Toktogul. She lives with her oldest son, while her two other children live separately. 

It was her daughter’s idea to try running this business, and she helped with the initial investment of 10,000 soms. It’s been ten years since the start-up, and the business is flourishing thanks to Jiydekan’s efforts. Jiydekan believes in the responsibility, ambition and hard work of her group members. She believes the loan from Kiva lenders will be a significant help for each of them.  Jiydekan plans to spend her own part on the purchase of additional head of livestock.

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is 29 years old, married and has one child who is three months old. He has sold second-hand shoes for six years and has employed two people.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been economically empowered. He has requested 50,000 KES to add to his stock of rubber shoes. He hopes to establish his business fully and employ more people.

loans.use: To add to his stock of rubber shoes

loans.name: Gnor

texts.en:
Gnor, 41, is married and has a baby who is not enrolled in school yet. She and her husband live in a wooden house in Reuessey Kao commune, Phnom Penh. Gnor earns a living as a foreman for the construction workers of a small company. She and her husband earn $8.70 more or less each day.

With a loan Gnor and her husband could increase their income to meet their family’s needs. She will use her loan and money from her saving account to buy a second-hand motorbike in order to replace the old one which is often broken.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand motorbike.

loans.name: Cerlita

texts.en:
Cerlita is a 49-year-old Filipina and is married with four children. She has been buying and selling cashew nuts for twenty years and also sells rice at retail. She works hard to provide for her family.

Cerlita has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more cashew nuts to sell. Prior to this request, she has borrowed and paid back 23 loans from NWTF.

Cerlita aspires to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy more cashew nuts to sell.

loans.name: Elijah Wanyoike

texts.en:
Elija Wanyoike is 25 years old and married to Judy, who owns a salon and contributes to the family income. He has been a dairy farmer for a period of about three years, with an income of approximately KES 12,000 per month.

This is his third loan with  KADET LTD, after paying the previous one successfully. He wants to use the loan to buy farm necessities and to expand the salon for his wife. 

He hopes to own a big farm which will support the family income and improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and to expand the salon for his wife

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maksatbu's Group

texts.en:
Maksatbu, 42, is a leader of this group. She is a resident of Toktogul and has 8 children. Very few of her female acquaintances have a college education or work in a high position. Maksatbu also wasn’t lucky enough to get educated and work for the sake of society. However, eight years ago she made an important decision, and, thanks to that, her life took a different direction. She rented a small space in a nearby market and stocked it with a variety of consumer goods to sell. Maksatbu values the quality of the product much more than its price. She realized that she was right when more and more customers got attracted to her unique goods of a high quality. 

The initial capital was 30,000 soms, which was alot for Maksatbu eight years ago. Nevertheless, she managed the business well and receives a profit of 10,000 soms monthly. She hopes to increase the goods circulation in the near future. 

The loan from Kiva will help her increase her range of goods and help her purchase an automobile from the generated profit. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 46 years old and married, with 4 children.
