Consolacion works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell, like sardines, curls, etc., in her sari-sari store.

Consolacion has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Consolacion aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Trymore Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 50 year-old Lenah (in the middle) from Mutare. She is widowed, with two children.  One attends school. She also cares for three dependents. Lenah runs a cross-border trading business, selling clothes, blankets, stoves, HiFis, as well as poultry. The business has been in operation for 2 years and she employs one person. She says the main challenge faced is a lack of working capital. 

Lenah has requested a loan of $400 to add to her business stock. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's quality of life. In the future Lenah plans to have improved her business further.

loans.use: to add business stock

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Estela works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending (barbecue) business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling scrap materials.  Estela is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more meat and ingredients for her barbecue business.

Estela has sustained her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more meat and ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a hardworking Filipina entrepreneur who has had an eatery for the past twenty years. She earns additional income from her general store and peanut sales.

Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and loans from NWTF. She is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her eatery. She dreams of saving enough to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her eatery.

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
Alpha is 40 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Alpha is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional piglets, feed and vitamins.

Alpha has been raising pigs for 12 years and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (variety) store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 27 years old, married and blessed with a two-year-old child.  For four years, he has been selling second-hand clothing and tailored clothes.  He has employed two people to assist him in the business.  

Through Faulu Kenya, he has managed to save his money and get business loans.  He hopes to increase his business stock and employ more people in his business in the future.  He has requested 80,000 Kes to buy more fabric for making clothes.

loans.use: To buy more fabric.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 40 years old, married to Isaac, and together they have two children, aged twelve and nineteen years old. She has been in the salon business for the last eight year, earning a profit of 30,000 per month.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a staff member and this will be her first loan. She plans to add to her stock of chemicals, braids, and such. As for the anticipated profit, she plans to open another salon.

In the future she hopes to open more than five salons and employ people.

loans.use: to add to her stock of chemicals, braids, and such.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase materials and spare parts for sidecar repair for her motorcycle transport business.

Judith has been in this business for 10 years. Judith earns more income from food vending (barbecue).

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Her dream is to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase materials and spare parts for sidecar repair.

loans.name: Maira

texts.en:
Maira is 38 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Maira has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her rice retailing business for one year and also earns an income from her piggery.

Maira aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Chhan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhan is a local farmer in Kompong Cham province. She has been working in agriculture since she was young and single. She is good at planting crops on her own fertile land and earns around $1.50 a profit a day to use for daily expenses. 

Mrs. Chhan is married to Mr. Soung, 67, who also works with her in the farm field.  They have seven children -- two are single and are working in a garment factory, while the other five are already married and live in their own houses.  

Mrs. Chhan would like to borrow some funds from Kiva in order to buy a motorcycle for her sons to ride to work.   She will use the rest of the loan to plant corn, sesame and sugar cane.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle for sons to ride to work

loans.name: Marin

texts.en:
Marin is a 38-year-old married man and father of four children.  He works in agriculture and is a farmer known by most of his villagers.  He is a man with a good reputation, a hardworker who does his best to provide his family with the best living. 

Marin is requesting a loan for the first time from A. Majmoua (a Kiva Partner) in order to buy fertilizer and do maintenance on his tractor, which are necessary means to support his main source of earning a living.

Marin had financiA. problems when he first started his business, but ambition and hard work has helped a lot in overcoming such obstacles.  What helped him most is that he owns the land which he's farming. Marin hopes to improve his business through expanding his crop production's variety, quality and quantity.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and service his tractor

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 50 years old.  She is is a single lady who runs a hotel as her primary business and supplies eggs as her secondary business. She has been running her businesses for the last fifteen years, earning a profit of KES 20,000 per month.

Mary was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend.  This will be her seventh loan. With this loan, she plans to renovate her hotel and add space to hold  more chairs for customers. From her anticipated profits, she plans to open another hotel.

In the future, Mary hopes to open up a tourist hotel and accommodations. She is very hardworking and committed.

loans.use: renovate her hotel

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en: Isaiah is 29 years old, married and has two children.  To earn a living, he runs a green grocery store.  He also does farming to supplement his income. Isaiah works hard in his business to provide for his family and educate his two children.  His desire is to open other outlets for his business in the surrounding area, due to the high competition.  Isaiah has requested a loan for 60, 000 Kes to buy more onions, tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.use: buy onions, tomatoes and potatoes
